In this journey we are now seeking an Application Manager to support the roll-out, management, maintenance and optimization of Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) and Autodesk Revit.
 



  





 While the roll-out to all Adapteo operating markets is led by a Project Manager, you will play a crucial role by contributing with hands-on knowledge and expertise to ensure successful implementation, adoption and continuous improvement once in place. Additionally, you will oversee key operations tools for Adapteo such as Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo, while establishing application management forums to drive best practices and continuous improvement. If you have a strong technical background and enjoy working collaboratively to enhance digital solutions, we want to hear from you!
 



 ,
 



**As An Operations Application Manager, You Will** 



* Support the roll-out of Autodesk Construction Cloud and Revit, providing handson expertise and advice to ensure smooth adoption.
* Act as an application advisor, assisting the Project Manager with implementation strategies and best practices.
* Establish and lead application management forums for ACC and Revit, facilitating collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Oversee and optimize the use of Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo.
* Provide and coordinate second line support, training, and documentation for key applications.
* Collaborate with internal teams such as our ERP Team and business process owners to improve processes, systems and data quality. And if you know anything about Business Central it’s a plus!
* Coordinate, align and communicate around software updates, troubleshoot issues, and ensure data integrity.
* Manage licenses and our key vendors that support our key operational tools.



  





**The Ideal Candidate Has** 



* A proven experience with ACC and Revit or similar collaboration and 3D design tools.
* Familiarity with Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo or similar tools is a plus.
* Experience in supporting business system roll-outs and working closely with project teams to ensure adoption of the suite according to group and local processes.
* Experience in designing, implementing and drive application management:
* Outline and agree on business priorities within applications.
* Establish and drive super user communities.
* Establish support organizations/processes (where super users are 1st line of support).
* Create and maintain application and end-user documentation.
* Manage vendors and licenses.
* Experience from acting as second line support.
* Experience from working/collaborating with ERP teams on operations processes.
* But most importantly the right attitude and willingness to learn quickly, to connect the dots even if they are far apart!



  





 If this sounds like a role for you, don’t hesitate to reach out! We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.

title: Partner Manager till Visma Publitech
description:
*Vi söker en engagerad och drivande Partner Manager för att utveckla och förvalta våra samarbeten med våra partners. Du kommer att spela en central roll i att bygga starka partnerrelationer och säkerställa effektivt samarbete genom hela organisationen. Låter det intressant? Läs då vidare!*
 Om rollen
   

  

 Som Partner Manager på Visma Publitech, kommer du att ha en central roll i att hantera och utveckla våra partnersamarbeten med syfte att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar till den svenska offentliga sektorn. Du kommer att fungera som den huvudsakliga kontaktpunkten för våra partners och arbeta nära interna team för att säkra efterlevnad och säkerställa att våra partnerskap uppfyller de höga krav som ställs på säkerhet och compliance.
   

  

 Publitech levererar marknadsledande lösningar inom lön, HR, ekonomi, schemaläggning samt logistik och lager till offentlig sektor i Sverige. För att säkerställa att vårt erbjudande stöttar marknadens hela behov samarbetar vi med ett gäng partners som är bäst inom sina respektive områden. För att utveckla och förbättra vårt samarbete med våra partners ytterligare initierar vi nu denna nya roll som Partner Manager.
   

  

 I rollen som Partner Manager ingår du i vår nya Commercial Product organisation. Här fokuserar vi på våra marknadsorienterade aktiviteter där vi bland annat säkerställer att vårt produktutbud stämmer överens med våra kunders behov och att vi tar vara på alla potentiella möjligheter på vår marknad. Commercial Product organisationen hanterar produktstrategi, marknadsföring och spelar en avgörande roll i att säkerställa att våra kunder har marknadens bästa erbjudande.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden Inkluderar**
* Utveckling och underhåll av samarbetsavtal: I samarbete med interna avdelningar skapa och uppdatera samarbetsavtal med våra partners.
* Partnerrelationer: Fungera som huvudkontaktperson för våra partners och arbeta aktivt för att upprätthålla och stärka långvariga, hållbara och affärsmässiga relationer.
* Förvaltning av partnerskap: Ansvara för den dagliga hanteringen av partnerskap och säkerställa att rätt processer och avtal finns på plats för bästa möjliga samarbete.
* Kontinuerlig utveckling och förbättring: Driva förbättringar i arbetssätt och processer för hur Visma Publitech samarbetar med partners, samt hålla regelbundna uppföljningsmöten för att säkerställa compliance och goda relationer.
* Kommunikation och information: Säkerställa att korrekt information finns tillgänglig för BID-teamet inför upphandlingar, samt kommunicera grundförutsättningar och tydlig information inom organisationen.


 Placeringsort är flexibelt mellan Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö. Andra placeringsorter kan också vara aktuellt för rätt kandidat. Vi tillämpar en flexibel hybridmodell med möjlighet kombinera arbete på kontoret och hemifrån.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som har relevant erfarenhet av att hantera partnerskap och avtal i en IT- eller teknologi-relaterad sektor. Du har en stark kommunikationsförmåga och är duktig på att bygga relationer och att samarbeta med andra. Du har lätt för att samarbeta tvärfunktionellt inom organisationen och med externa partners. Vidare har du en kommersiell förståelse, är resultatorienterad och kan hantera flera parallella projekt. För att trivas i rollen ser vi också att du behöver vara flexibel och anpassningsbar då du befinner dig i en dynamisk och snabbt föränderlig miljö.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. Vi tror också att du har en högskole-/universitetetsexamen inom IT/ekonomi/HR, eller motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade på annat sätt.
   

  

**Det är även meriterande om du har**
* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor
* Tidigare erfarenhet av liknande verksamhet och systemlösningar
* God förståelse för säkerhets- och compliance-krav som ställs av och på den offentliga sektorn.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig på Visma Publitech?**
 Visma Publitech drar fördelarna med att vara ett entreprenöriellt bolag med ett nära samarbete och en varm familjär kultur, samtidigt som vi ingår i en av Europas ledande IT-koncerner. Med en vision om att stärka offentlig sektor med innovativa lösningar bidrar vi till maximerad verksamhetsnytta och ett hållbart samhälle.
   

  

 Vi är oerhört stolta över vårt höga medarbetarengagemang som placerar oss på topp-tio procent i tech-branschen!
   

  

**Flexibilitet i alla skeden av livet:** 
 Vi vet att du är så mycket mer än bara ditt jobb. Det är därför viktigt för oss att vi erbjuder dig en bra balans mellan fritid och arbetsliv. Vi har en flexibel hybridmodell mellan arbete hemifrån och på kontoret utifrån behov och önskemål.
   

  

**Framför allt är vi ett team:** 
 Teamkänsla är det som får oss att kunna hålla våra löften och leverera på en hög nivå, men också det som gör att vi kan främja en hållbar företagskultur där vi stöttar och bryr oss om varandra.
   

  

 Läs mer om Publitech, våra förmåner och vårt erbjudande här.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du söker tjänsten via länken. Vi kommer att genomföra urval och kalla till intervjuer löpande då det är tillträde snarast, skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du ansöker med ett CV och personligt brev på svenska.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller önskar mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

 Nina Lemic, mail: nina.lemic@visma.com eller mobil: 070-384 90 08.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Läs mer om vår integritetspolicy
 **här**

title: Customer Service Specialist
description:
**The story of Fairlo began when our founders, Jimmy and Shamon, saw first-hand how unfair and predatory lending practices can trap people in cycles of debt. Their mother had been misled by a large bank, and instead of being offered a lifeline, she was pushed further into financial difficulties. That injustice sparked something: to build a company that reimagines credit - rooted in transparency, flexibility, and respect. That company became Fairlo.** 




  





**Where we are now** 




 Since launching in 2018, Fairlo has helped tens of thousands of customers access responsible credit when life happens. With 35,000+ active users, a 4.7 Trustpilot rating from 4 100+ reviews, and an incredibly low churn rate, we’re proving that transparency and flexibility is not only the right thing to do - it’s a winning model.
 



 We’re a tight team of 30 people based in Stockholm, Crete, and the UK. Backed by some of Sweden’s most experienced investors and driven by a culture that prizes kindness, courage, collaboration and common sense, we’re very proud of what we’ve built so far.
 



  





**Where we’re going** 




 In line with our long-term vision, we're entering an exciting new chapter of growth. This next phase is about scaling responsibly, driving innovation, and creating fair, transparent financial products that support our customers through every stage of life - all while staying true to our mission of building a fairer world, even when it comes to money.
 



  





**Are you our next Customer Service Specialist?** 




 We’re now looking for a service-minded, sharp, and tech-savvy team player who thrives on helping people and solving problems. As our next Customer Service Specialist, you’ll be the voice of Fairlo - supporting our customers with care, clarity, and purpose.
 



  





**Some of the things you’ll do:** 



* Respond to customer inquiries via email, phone, and chat in a timely and professional manner
* Troubleshoot and resolve customer issues effectively, escalating complex cases when necessary
* Follow up with customers to ensure satisfaction and issue resolution
* Provide accurate information about products & services
* Collaborate with other departments to solve customer-related problems
* Identify and report recurring issues or trends to help improve customer service processes
* Stay up to date with product knowledge and company updates



  





**What we believe you bring:** 



* A caring, social personality that thrives in a fast-moving, purpose-driven environment
* At least 2 years of experience in a comparable customer service position
* High computer proficiency and comfort working with different systems and tools
* A natural ability to communicate clearly and empathetically in both Swedish and English
* Strong organizational skills and a proactive, solution-oriented mindset
* Sharp attention to detail and the ability to handle ambiguity with calm and confidence
* A self-starter mentality, no prestige, and a collaborative attitude
* Passion for fairness, financial inclusion, and responsible lending



  





**Even better if you also have:** 



* Previous experience in the financial, credit, or debt collection industry
* Lived and worked in the UK and an understanding of financial services in the UK
* Experience working with Zendesk or similar customer support platforms
* A knack for tech and data - you’re interested in helping us improve how we track and understand customer contact



  





**Where you’ll work:** 




 Mostly in our Stockholm office, with occasional travel to our tech hub in Crete and the UK team. We offer a hybrid model, competitive benefits, and - most importantly - a deeply supportive and purpose-driven culture.
 



  





 If you’re ready to combine your expertise with a mission that truly matters, we’d love to meet you. Apply today and join us in creating a more fair financial world.

title: Account Executive
description:
**Description**
 Automat-it is where high-growth startups turn when they need to move faster, scale smarter, and make the most of the cloud. As an AWS Premier Partner, we deliver hands-on DevOps and FinOps and GenAI support that drives real results.
   

  

 We work across EMEA, fueling innovation and solving complex challenges daily. Join us to grow your skills, shape bold ideas, and help build the future of tech.
   

  

 We’re seeking an Account Executive to drive Automat-it business growth in the EMEA north territory of Greenfield accounts while assuring a great customer experience. You’ll be responsible for the sales process, from prospecting to closing a deal.
   

  

 📍 Work location - remote from Stockholm with weekly visits to AWS office
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute successful targeted territory development plans to help achieve or exceed growth, revenue, and margin targets
* Develop and manage all phases of the territory’s business development cycle, including managing proposal negotiations, the statement-of-work, and completion of all contract details
* Demonstrates breadth and depth of knowledge in aligning Automat-it capabilities to client business and positioning relative to competitors
* Prospect new customers and communicate with the AWS reps regularly
* Maintain and develop strategic vendor relations with AWS
* Regularly attend business events to promote and educate prospective clients on the benefits of Automat-it
* Work collaboratively with Marketing, Operations, Delivery, and Solutions Architects
* Commitment to regular business travel locally and abroad


**Requirements**
* 4+ years of experience in direct IT sales and business development from a complex cloud or software solutions
* Experience selling IT professional services (consulting/managed/staff services) or SaaS solutions designed for R&D or DevOps teams
* Ability to articulate the value proposition of professional services to technical and business stakeholders
* Proven successful track record of meeting and exceeding sales quotas
* Experience with selling AWS-based solutions
* Network and relationships with Swedish-based digital native/ISV/startup companies
* Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Swedish
* Excellent presentation and organizational skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Working experience with Salesforce or Hubspot
* AWS cloud certificated - advantage


 Automat-it is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all and believes that a diverse workforce is crucial to our success. Our recruitment decisions are based on your experience and skills, recognizing the value you bring to our team.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Professional training and certifications covered by the company (AWS, FinOps, Kubernetes, etc.)
* International work environment
* Referral program – enjoy cooperation with your colleagues and get a bonus
* Company events and social gatherings (happy hours, team events, knowledge sharing, etc.)
* Wellbeing and professional coaching through Oliva Health
* English classes
* Soft skills training


 Country-specific benefits will be discussed during the hiring process.
   

  

 Automat-it is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all and believes that a diverse workforce is crucial to our success. Our recruitment decisions are based on your experience and skills, recognizing the value you bring to our team.

title: Strategist
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024, 2025), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 We are now looking for a Strategist to work closely together with our strategy team. This is a group role that spans across both Media, Digital and Creative, with focus on Media.
   

  

 As a Strategist at Publicis Groupe you will maintain a holistic perspective on how to grow our client’s business looking at marketing at large with focus on effectiveness. Creating perfect alignment between insight- and strategy and how that is best executed in a consistent and coherent way in the activities and channels that will maximize the highest effect. You are integral to client teams and run ‘day to day’ with some guidance. Specialists and account leads look for you to help them with briefing and de-briefing, give strategic direction and prioritize or to prove an argument. Management knows you can be trusted to establish and substantiate a point of view.
   

  

 As Strategist you will also play a crucial role in acquiring new business. Focus is on ensuring consistent and high-quality strategic work to make sure we win, keep and grow business.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Strategic direction and recommendations for clients and in pitches, with focus on media.’
* Acting as a driving force in winning new business, ensuring consistent and high-quality strategic work into local, Nordic and international pitches to ensure we win new business.
* Collaborate with client leadership to ensure the quality of our strategic output on our current clients.Lean in on key clients as the Strategic Lead and build strong relationships as a trusted advisor - this to strengthen our position as a strategic partner (and thereby improve retention and increase satisfaction scores).
* Working closely together with the Global Strategy Team on our strategic product and implement the use of global frameworks, processes, models, tools and products locally.
* Design, package and promote services/communication solutions and ways of working (Power of One) that drives client value and provide business growth for us as a group.
* Keep up to date with trends (market, brand, consumer, media, tech etc) and the latest marketing science. Ensure that the client teams and our clients are informed and inspired about the latest trends and research. Inspire and coach agency teams to be better planners and strategists and ensure they are trained in the network’s strategic frameworks, models, processes and tools.
* Build agency reputation across the industry and within the marketing community. Strengthen our position as a leader when it comes to strategy through e.g. thought leadership pieces, PR, seminars, strategic partnerships, newsletters etc.
* Be a key player internally when it comes to creating award winning work. Support agency teams in compiling agency submissions to industry awards.


**Qualifications**
**Who are you?**
 We believe you are the missing piece - people count on you to add value to any strategic and/or creative argument. You are the expert on all aspects of media & comms strategy and aware of all latest trends and developments. Interest reaches broader than the daily campaign management and aims to drive strategic direction and innovation putting us at the front of the most clever use of media x creativity.
   

  

**Craft Skills**
**Research**
* Master in analytical thinking and drawing conclusions of research reports;
* Understand media-reports and analysis;
* Great understanding and practical skillset of AI and AI tools


**Strategy**
* Ability to use data and insights to form clear strategy direction and prioritization;
* Challenge clients in their objectives and strategies;
* Writing clear strategy presentations with a point of view;
* Master in writing debriefs;
* Writing case-studies;


**Presence**
* Excellent presentation skills;
* Command the room: make people listen to your ideas;
* Run workshops.


**Your qualities & competencies are**
* Be a great sparring partner for your clients;
* Write decks with good narratives;
* Oversee key projects independently;
* Master of debrief and creative brief;
* Curious mindset at all times;
* Out-of-the-box thinker.


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: HSE Manager
description:
One of our client in Sweden is seeking a HSE Manager to join their onshore wind project. This role offers an immediate start and a unique rotation schedule of three weeks on, one week off, providing a balanced work-life dynamic.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 


* Oversee all HSE activities on the onshore wind project site.
* Develop and implement HSE policies and procedures.
* Conduct regular site inspections and audits to ensure compliance with local and international regulations.
* Lead incident investigations and implement corrective actions.
* Provide HSE training and support to site personnel.
* Liaise with stakeholders to promote a culture of safety and environmental responsibility.



  





 Essential Skills and Experience:
 


* Proven experience as an HSE Manager, preferably within the renewable energy sector.
* In-depth knowledge of HSE regulations and best practices.
* Strong leadership and communication skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Relevant qualifications in Health, Safety, and Environmental Management.
* Fluency in English; knowledge of Swedish is advantageous but not essential.



  





 The rotation schedule allows for extended periods of rest and personal time, making it an attractive option for those seeking a balanced lifestyle while advancing their career in the renewable energy sector.
 



  





 If you are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role that makes a tangible impact on the environment, this could be the perfect fit.

title: Tech Lead till Ramudden Global Products & Digital AB
description:
*Vill du kombinera tekniskt ledarskap med samhällsnytta? Som Tech Lead på Ramudden Global blir du en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av vår molnbaserade plattform för device management – en lösning som bidrar till ökad trafiksäkerhet globalt. Här får du kombinera strategi och kod, arbeta i en modern teknikstack och leda ett dedikerat team mot smarta, skalbara lösningar.*
**Din vardag:**
 Vi söker en
 **Tech Lead** 
 till vårt Global Platform Team i Stockholm. Här blir du en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av en modern, molnbaserad plattform för global hantering av digitala enheter. Plattformen möjliggör enhetlig device management genom integration av olika hårdvarukomponenter, hantering av statusförändringar och koppling till externa tjänster.
   

  

 Som Tech Lead ansvarar du för den tekniska riktningen inom teamet. Du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt – från systemdesign till kodning – och säkerställer att vi levererar pålitliga, skalbara lösningar.
   

  

 Teknikstack:
   

  

* Backend: .NET 9.0, C#
* Frontend: React, TypeScript
* Databaser: PostgreSQL, PostGIS
* Data & analys: Stitch, DBT, Snowflake, Power BI
* Molnmiljö: Azure (bl.a. Service Bus, Container Apps)
* Arkitekturprinciper: Clean Architecture, CQRS, Domain-Driven Design, Event-Driven Architecture


 DevOps-verktyg: Docker, GitHub Actions, Infrastructure as Code (Bicep)
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk bakgrund och ett naturligt intresse för att leda och utveckla team. Du har ett agilt tankesätt och vill bidra till teamets och plattformens fortsatta utveckling. Du har flera års erfarenhet av objektorienterad programmering, exempelvis i C#, Java och backendutveckling, och är van att arbeta med systemarkitektur och mjukvarudesign för distribuerade system samt en god förståelse för hur olika tekniska delar samverkar i en helhetslösning.
   

  

 Utöver detta ser vi gärna att du:
   

  

* Förstår och tillämpar principer som Clean Architecture och Domain-Driven Design
* Har erfarenhet av testautomatisering och CI/CD-processer
* Gillar att bygga lösningar som integrerar hårdvara – ett plus om du har teknikintresse även utanför jobbet


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av IoT eller device management-system
* Erfarenhet av data pipelines eller samarbete med data engineering-team
* Erfarenhet av PostgreSQL/PostGIS


**Passar vi för dig?**
 Ramudden Global Products & Digital AB är en ledande aktör inom tillfälliga trafikanordningar (TTM) för kritisk infrastruktur. Genom att kombinera uthyrning av trafiksäkerhetsutrustning med digitala lösningar och tjänster skapar vi tryggare miljöer världen över.
   

  

 Vi finns i 13 länder, har över 5 000 medarbetare och en årlig omsättning på cirka 1 miljard euro. Vårt uppdrag – att alla ska komma hem säkert varje dag – genomsyrar hela vår verksamhet.
   

  

 Vi tror på kraften i samarbete, innovation och hållbar utveckling. Hos oss bidrar du till en säkrare värld genom att tänka nytt och arbeta tillsammans med engagerade kollegor.
   

  

**Ansökan & kontakt**
 Vi på Ramudden arbetar varje dag för att säkerställa trygga arbetsmiljöer. Därför ingår alkohol- och drogtest samt bakgrundskontroll i vår rekryteringsprocess. Tjänsten rekryteras i samarbete med Wise IT. Har du frågor, kontakta rekryteringskonsult Alexandra Karlsson på alexandra.karlsson@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post – ansök istället via annonsen. Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen att bli en del av ett globalt företag där du gör skillnad – varje dag.

title: Transformation Manager - Finance & Accounting
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 Do you have an interest in working with developing finance and accounting processes? Are you a collaborator and a true team player that likes to coach and build cross functional networks? Do you have a strong ability to manage transformation? If so, the role as Transformation Manager might be your next step!
   

  

 As Transformation Manager Finance & Accounting in the transformation office team, you will drive transformation and development and lead project initiatives in our different Finance processes. Help design and ensure that our new ways of working are implemented and secure operational performance in Finance & Accounting. You will execute and track project progress and exceptions according to the project plan as well as leading project teams and coordinate across all involved stakeholders. You will mitigate project risks and ensure the workstream accordingly to timelines and targeted quality. You will work closely with our Shared Service Center, our different sales organizations and central Finance & Accounting including Global Process Owners.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Operational responsible to initiate, plan, lead, execute and follow-up project activities.
* Prepare, present and secure budgets, business case and project timelines.
* Secure project handover to ensure business continuity, new routines, and standards.
* Structure the way of working for an efficient and automated process together with suppliers and business experts.
* Empower and inspire the team to challenge the status quo.
* Identify and suggest areas for improvement to the transformation office.
* Identify training needs and implementation of domain specific, operational & behavioral trainings for the different working processes.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 The CFO Office vision is to enable growth while ensuring that H&M Group is a well-managed company. By creating long-term value through securing resilient financials, profitable and sustainable growth and value-creating governance.
   

  

 The Transformation Office within Finance & Accounting is focused on improving our operations and processes through a combination of automation efforts, standardization and centralization. In this role you will be responsible for driving the transformation and development in our processes, you will be part of the project team driving the shift towards a truly digital organization.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
* At least 3+ years experience from project management with larger transformation projects within multiple functions, preferably as a project lead and within finance & accounting. You provide great knowledge and ideas when it comes to digital transformation
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to customize communication to different needs and stakeholders
* Experience from working with automatization & digitalization of processes
* Expertise in application migration processes (SAP) and skilled in transition (e.g. knowledge transfers and implementation of SOP’s) and operational improvements to maximize productivity and efficiency
* Experience of designing and developing operational processes


*And people who have:*
* An understanding of the impact on processes both from accounting perspective as well as business perspective
* Knowledge of project implementation approaches and methods
* Strong ability to develop and lead an organization through changes (change management)
* Strong communications skills in English


**JOIN US**
 This is a full-time position with flexible placement at one of our H&M offices but with consideration that working hours needs to be adapted to the Central European time zone. Some travel would be required to our Stockholm office. You will become part of the Finance & Accounting: Transformation office team.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible but latest by June 30. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP


 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

title: Teknisk SAP-Konsult
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Custom Software Development, and Software Development
description:
*Brinner du för SAP-teknik och har förmågan att kombinera teknisk expertis med funktionell insikt? Vi söker dig som vill skapa förståelse för våra kunders affärsprocesser och inspirera dem att utveckla innovativa tekniska lösningar.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som teknisk SAP-konsult hos Zington blir du en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa våra kunder att realisera sina digitala ambitioner. Ditt uppdrag är att omsätta affärsbehov till praktiska och innovativa SAP-lösningar. Med en djup förståelse för verktygets mångsidighet hjälper du kunder att agera på deras kunddata, vilket optimerar deras affärsprocesser. Oavsett om det gäller automatisering, rapportering eller integration med andra system, blir du den expert som vägleder och formar den tekniska lösningen i samarbete med kund och team. I denna roll kombineras teknisk skicklighet med strategisk insikt, arbetandes sida vid sida med Zingtons expertteam. Vill du ta din karriär till nästa nivå och utveckla framtidens kundupplevelser? Välkommen att ansöka!
 



  





**Dina kompetenser och egenskaper** 



* Utbildning som ingenjör, ekonom eller arbetslivserfarenheter som demonstrerar en stark förmåga att sätta sig in och lösa problem.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av SAP, gärna i rollen som konsult.
* Förstår vikten av göra det lilla extra när det behövs men kan samtidigt ge sig själv (och andra) en paus när det behövs.
* Trivs i att verka i en föränderlig miljö och inser att flexibilitet är en superkraft.
* Vågar ta hjälp och även hjälpa andra.
* Nyfiken.



  





**Mer om rollen** 




 Vi rekryterar löpande och ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt men månar om att hitta rätt person. Därför värderar vi dina personliga egenskaper och att vi trivs ihop högt.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta rekryterande chef Andreas Åkerblad på andreas.akerblad@zingtongroup.com
 



  





**Om Zington** 




 Zington är ett konsultföretag med expertis inom Management, IT och Design. Vår resa började redan 2008 men idag är vi 250 medarbetare i Stockholm och fler än 4000 kollegor globalt inom VASS koncernen. Vi stöttar kunder som ex. Atrium Ljungberg, Axfood, Apollo och Fora i digital transformation genom att skapa tjänster, bygga lösningar och utforma strategier som driver affären framåt. På Zington ligger vår styrka i våra medarbetare. Oavsett om du är en specialist eller generalist kan vi som konsultföretag erbjuda dig en plats att växa och trivas på. Vi strävar efter att vara en plats där vi stöttar varandra, delar med oss av vår kunskap och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår framgång bygger på engagerade människor – när du växer, växer företag.

title: Construction Manager- Pharma, Life Science & Industrial
company_industry: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Company Description**
 Turner & Townsend is a global professional services company with over 22,000 people in more than 60 countries.
   

  

 Working with our clients across real estate, infrastructure, energy and natural resources, we transform together delivering outcomes that improve people’s lives. Working in partnership makes it possible to deliver the world’s most impactful projects and programmes as we turn challenge into opportunity and complexity into success.
   

  

 Our capabilities include programme, project, cost, asset and commercial management, controls and performance, procurement and supply chain, net zero and digital solutions.
   

  

 We are majority-owned by CBRE Group, Inc., the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with our partners holding a significant minority interest. Turner & Townsend and CBRE work together to provide clients with the premier programme, project and cost management offering in markets around the world.
   

  

 Please visit our website: www.turnerandtownsend.com
   

  

**Job Description**
 Turner and Townsend are looking for a Construction Manager to work on major construction projects.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and manage a suite of governance, communication and management control systems for the proper conduct and assured delivery of the client’s essential services and works.
* Review the organisation structures of the parties and recommend alignment measures
* Interface management between contractors
* Monitor overall team performance and initiate any required safety or performance improvement measures and methodologies.
* Monitor and audit compliance with the requirements of the management systems and report as required.
* Active engagement in the Project Risk Management process to continually identify project risks, actively assign and drive mitigation management activities.
* Initiate and conduct weekly technical and progress meetings relating to the services and works.
* Manage any client stage gateway reviews and attainment of conditions precedent to such approvals.
* Manage the attainment of design stage deliverables to schedule and quality that may be concurrent with any fast track works package procurements and associated permitting and approvals requirements.
* Conduct and lead site progress reviews on a daily basis to review HSE, logistics and progress against the programme.
* Produce formal reports on project progress measured against the baseline and milestone dates and agreed project-wide KPI’s.
* Prepare weekly, monthly and ad-hoc reports on project progress for the Employer’s representative, prepare and conduct presentations as required.
* Manage and administer the relevant contracts affording appropriate protection of the client’s interests.
* Manage the timely issuance of company invoices and receipts against the agreed contract.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum 8 years of experience in construction management experience, preferably within the Life Sciences / Pharma/ Industrial or associated sectors.
* Bachelors’ Degree or related construction experience.
* Excellent written, verbal and analytic skills.
* Self-directed and able to function with ease as part of a team and to effectively collaborate with internal and external resources.
* Strong commercial awareness, including Financial management familiarity for project tracking and forecasting.
* Understanding of contract documents, specifications, project plans, and all other project related documents.
* Ability to multi-task and identify priority activities.
* Basic knowledge of construction estimation.
* Fluent in English and Swedish


**Additional Information**
 Our people share our Purpose and Values. Turner & Townsend provides a great place to work, where everyone can make change happen and influence a better world.
   

  

 We champion our people to succeed in both work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive, and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.
   

  

 Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.
   

  

 Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/
   

  

 Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:
   

  

 Twitter
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:
   

  

 Twitter
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

*It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.*
*Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.*

title: Systemförvaltare till MediCarrier
description:
MediCarrier är Region Stockholms logistik- och transportföretag, och vårdens externa lager. Från 1 januari 2021 ansvarar MediCarrier även för regionens beredskapslager avseende kritisk skyddsutrustning och kritiska förbrukningsartiklar till hälso- och sjukvården. Vi är ett dynamiskt och växande bolag med ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag. Vi omsätter cirka 1,4 miljarder kronor, hanterar 9 000 orderrader per dag och gör 30 000 angöringar per månad.
   

  

**Beskrivning**
 Lockas du av en roll där du får kombinera systemförvaltning och ekonomi, där du arbetar i gränssnittet mellan MediCarriers order- och ekonomisystem? Som Systemförvaltare hos MediCarrier identifierar du utvecklingsmöjligheter, driver digitalisering och förbättringsarbete.
   

  

 Om du vill göra skillnad för medarbetare och patienter inom Region Stockholm samt vill arbeta på en inkluderande arbetsplats med många spännande projekt i närtid, varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Om Tjänsten**
 Som systemförvaltare säkerställer du att MediCarriers redovisningssystem fungerar optimalt och att företagets ekonomiska data hanteras på ett korrekt och effektivt sätt. Du arbetar med systemhantering och visst ekonomiskt arbete för att säkerställa att ekonomiska processer är i linje med interna och externa krav. I det dagliga arbetet rapporterar du till redovisningsansvarig, medan din närmaste chef kommer vara chefen för bolagets stab Ekonomi och Administration.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak**
* Drift och utveckling av företagets redovisningssystem (Raindance).
* Funktionalitet för orderhanteringssystemet (IMI Supply Chain Solution)
* Löpande stämma av filer mellan systemen och till våra kunder.
* Samordna och genomföra tester vid systemuppdateringar och systemförändringar.
* Utbilda och stödja kollegor i användandet av systemen.
* Arbeta med att optimera och automatisera arbetsflöden inom ekonomi och redovisning.
* Identifiera och implementera förbättringsåtgärder för effektivare hantering av redovisningssystemet.
* Löpande bokföringsuppgifter.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi vill att du har en akademisk eller eftergymnasial utbildning inom ekonomi och/eller systemvetenskap. Du är systemstark och har minst tre års erfarenhet av systemförvaltning där du arbetat med systemimplementation, automatisering och effektivisering i ekonomisystem. En god förståelse för lagerredovisning är en viktig förutsättning för rollen, och erfarenhet av arbete i orderhanteringssystem ses som en tydlig fördel. Du är van att arbeta i Excel och andra ekonomiska analysverktyg. Erfarenhet av Raindance samt kunskaper i programmering eller systemintegration är särskilt meriterande och stärker din profil ytterligare. Meriterande är också kunskaper i redovisning och bokslutsarbete.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som Systemförvaltare behöver du ha en skarp analytisk förmåga och motiveras av att förbättra och effektivisera arbetsprocesser. Du arbetar strukturerat, är pålitlig och detaljorienterad med ett naturligt fokus på att leverera resultat av hög kvalitet. Vidare är du prestigelös i ditt arbetssätt, oavsett uppgiftens nivå. Eftersom rollen innebär nära samarbete med både interna kollegor och externa samarbetspartners lägger vi stor vikt vid din kommunikativa förmåga och din förmåga att förklara tekniska systemlösningar på ett pedagogiskt sätt, även för icke-tekniska användare.
   

  

**Villkor**
**I denna rekrytering samarbetar MediCarrier med Poolia, urval sker löpande, ansök därför redan idag genom att klicka på ansök på**
 https://www.poolia.se/lediga-jobb/stockholm/systemforvaltare-till-medicarrier/73740/
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Det finns möjlighet till visst distansarbete. Arbetsplatsen är belägen på vårt huvudkontor i Spånga, med goda förbindelser med kollektivtrafik. Arbetsspråket är svenska.
   

  

 Hos MediCarrier blir du en del av en flexibel och prestigelös organisation med högt engagemang. Som ny medarbetare får du ett gediget introduktionsprogram som ger dig en god förståelse för hela vår verksamhet. MediCarrier är en del av Region Stockholm och vi arbetar efter våra gemensamma värdeord: samverkan, kompetens, pålitlighet och öppenhet.
   

  

 Som en hälsofrämjande arbetsplats erbjuder vi ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kronor, friskvårdstimme och tillgång till vårt företagsgym. Du har också möjlighet att delta i aktiviteter som främjar välmående. Vi erbjuder dessutom lunchförmån genom Edenred och subventionerade friskvårdsaktiviteter via Benify.
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Spånga | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/3099 | Kontakt: Erik Ekholm 0702189487, | Publicerat: 2025-06-09 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-27

title: Enterprise Account Executive
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
At
 
 Frends iPaaS
 
 , we are dedicated to redefining the future of integrations and automation. Our mission is to make integrations fast, easy, and transparent.
 



  





 Frends is expanding its presence in Sweden, and we’re looking for
 **top-performing, target-driven enterprise sales professional** 
 to join our growing team.
 



  





**In this role,** 
 your primary responsibility is to create new enterprise customers for our integration platform,
 
 Frends eiPaaS
 
 . We promise you full support from Frends sales organization and technical experts. At Frends, we have a low hierarchy and little bureaucracy, and we trust our people and give them space to operate. Of course, we expect results.
 



  





 If you enjoy working with a Nordic iPaaS leader and global challenger, a niche area to focus on technically, high speed, and growth with great people and a low hierarchy culture, this opportunity could be great for you!
 



  





**Frends iPaaS is** 
 a modern European, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller customers and in both private and public sectors in various industries.
 **Frends** 
 is recognized 3rd year in the
 **Gartner**
*®*
**Magic Quadrant™**
 for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends is also awarded in
 **G2 review**
 with the "Momentum Leader (API Management)," "Best Usability," "Easiest to Use & Admin," "Highest User Adoption," "Most Implementable," "Fastest Implementation," and "Fastest Time to Value" badges in 2025. Our customers give us 4.7 out of 5 stars on Gartner Peer Insights.
 



  





**🔥 About the Role** 




  





**As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will** 
 focus on new enterprise business acquisition. Your responsibility is to drive new customer growth by managing the full sales cycle—from prospecting to closing high-value enterprise deals.
 



  





 You will be at the forefront of our continued expansion in Sweden, working with a proven product, strong customer references, and an experienced team, including technical solution architects, to help you succeed.
 



  





**💼 What You Will Be Doing** 




  





 ✔
 **Own the full sales cycle** 
 – from prospecting to closing, driving new customer acquisition
 



 ✔
 **Expand our footprint in Sweden** 
 – Work strategically to grow our presence and maximize revenue potential
 



 ✔
 **Close high-value deals** 
 – Engage with CTOs, CIOs, and IT leaders to build strong business cases
 



 ✔
 **Develop and execute a winning sales strategy** 
 – Create a clear territory plan and exceed revenue targets
 



 ✔
 **Leverage top-tier SaaS sales methodologies** 
 – Apply MEDDIC, Challenger, and value-based selling to drive deal success
 



 ✔
 **Collaborate with Pre-Sales** 
 – Work with technical experts to deliver the best possible solutions for customers
 



  





**What it´s like to sell Frends?** 
 You can read Frends Senior Account Executive thoughts from our
 
 blog.
 




  





**🎯 Why Join Frends Now?** 




  




* **Be Part of a Strong, Scaling Team:** 
 Sweden is already established, and we are growing further
* **Make an Impact:** 
 Affect Frends' growth in Sweden, shaping success in this strategic region
* **Career Growth:** 
 Take on a critical role with continuous learning in a fast-growing company
* **Nordic Leader, Global Challenger:** 
 Join one of the Nordics' top integration technology organizations with its own platform, Frends, a well-established product with strong demand
* **Thriving Integration Field:** 
 Join a vital and growing field of integrations where your skills make a difference—
 
 integrations
 
 keep the world spinning
* **Pre-Sales Support:** 
 Collaborate with
 
 presales
 
 and other experts to craft the best solutions for diverse use cases
* **Work Flexibly:** 
 Enjoy modern, flexible working times and hybrid remote work
* **Competitive Compensation:** 
 Earn a fixed salary with performance-based incentives



  





**Read from our
 
 fresh blog
 
 why talents choose Frends and why Frendszies stay with us.** 




  





**💪 What You Bring** 




  





 ✅
 **Strong B2B SaaS / Software solution sales expertise** 
 – with a 5+ year track record of success in Saas/PaaS new business acquisition, you know how to sell value, navigate complex sales cycles, and influence key
 **Enterprise IT decision-makers** 




 ✅
 **Ability to navigate enterprise organizations,** 
 identifying key stakeholders and building a strong sales pipeline
 



 ✅
 **Ability to build pipeline & close deals** 
 – You take full ownership of your territory and prospecting strategy
 



 ✅
 **Knowledge & curiosity towards technical solutions** 
 – understanding of integration technology, familiarity with SaaS/PaaS solutions, ideally also iPaaS
 



 ✅
 **Fluent in high-impact SaaS sales methodologies** 
 – Familiarity with MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales, or similar
 



 ✅
 **Great communication & negotiation skills** 
 – You can confidently handle high-stakes sales conversations and adept at identifying and utilizing internal resources to support your sales cycle
 



**✅ Superb listening skills** 
 – You must understand and empathize with our customers/prospects' pain points with a solution and value-based mindset
 



  





 🌍
 **Location & Language: The role requires fluent/native Swedish and professional English** 
 (both verbally and in writing), as well as
 **living in Sweden with a work permit.** 
 We support hybrid work mode but also require visiting our Stockholm office in Katarinavägen on a weekly basis. Occasionally, traveling is needed to meet customers and teams and attend events.
 



  





**⭐ Interested in joining us? Apply now!** 




  





 If you want to impact and join our growth journey, please contact us and tell us more about yourself!
 



  





**Additional Information** 




  




* The start is flexible according to your situation, and we offer a permanent, full-time position.
* The position will be filled as soon as the right person is found.
* You will be reporting to the Regional Director, Sweden.
* Our recruitment process includes around three discussions with a case presentation included. To ensure a smooth and informative process, you will meet at least our People Integrator, Regional Director, Sweden, and CRO. Reference checks are also included.
* Please note that we accept applications for this position only through our career website.

title: Group Compliance Officer at Scania
description:
***Scania is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Group Compliance Officer to join our headquarters at Scania CV AB. This role provides the opportunity to shape the future of compliance at a global leader in sustainable transport.***




  





**About Scania** 




 Scania is a world leading provider of transport solutions of trucks, buses with an extensive product related service offering designed to meet heavy transport needs. Together with partners and customers Scania is driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system, with its 58,000 employees in more than 100 countries We embrace a culture of continuous improvement, openness, and respect, fostering diversity and inclusion. At Scania, you are welcomed as you are and empowered to grow both personally and professionally.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 Joining Scania means becoming part of a company deeply committed to sustainability, innovation, and efficiency. Guided by our core values and the ”Scania Way,” we lead the global transport industry in delivering safe and sustainable solutions for the future.
 



 Currently, Scania is undergoing a transformative journey, evolving from a manufacturer of trucks and engines to supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions. Within this context, the Group Compliance function plays a critical role in reducing compliance risks by providing knowledge and advice in terms of policies, guidelines or trainings and by setting up respective structures and processes within the area of competition law, anti-corruption, anti-money laundering (AML), and human rights. This position offers a dynamic, global, and multicultural work environment where you will collaborate across functions to support Scania’s transformation.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 As the Group Compliance Officer, you will play an instrumental role in shaping Scania’s compliance strategies and addressing key risks and challenges from both a strategic and operational perspective. Collaborating closely with Group Legal & Compliance and stakeholders across Scania’s global organization, you will contribute to the company’s ongoing transformation and sustainability goals.
 



  





**Your responsibilities include:** 




  




* Enhancing and continuously improving the Compliance Management System.
* Identifying, managing, and mitigating risks related to anti-corruption, AML, competition law, and human rights.
* Promoting a culture of compliance and integrity throughout the organization.
* Advising and effectively communicating on compliance matters across all levels of the organization.
* Conducting risk assessments, addressing compliance challenges, and delivering tailored training programs.
* Overseeing third-party due diligence processes.



  





 Integrating compliance considerations into business processes and strategic decision-making.You will work closely together with the management functions of Scania CV AB. You will also manage multiple transactions simultaneously, ensuring timely completion and adherence to deadlines and coordinate cross-functional teams with various functions. You will work in an international, multicultural and cross functional environment so it is important that you have an open mind for different cultural and economic environments. Your flexibility and cultural sensitivity will be crucial in navigating diverse organizational contexts.
 



  





**Your Profile** 




 To succeed in this role, we believe you possess the following qualifications and attributes:
 


* A law degree or equivalent academic background.
* 5–10 years of solid experience in compliance roles within a large multinational corporation or law firm.
* Strong commercial acumen, with the ability to align compliance strategies with business objectives and assess their commercial impact.
* A proactive, resilient, and collaborative mindset, with the ability to inspire and motivate others.
* Adaptability to change and an interest in technological advancements in compliance practices.
* demonstrated track record of managing and executing complex projects in the compliance area
* Leadership experience is highly desirable.



  





 Professional fluency in both Swedish and English is required, and proficiency in additional languages will be considered an advantage. Please note that a background check may be conducted as part of the recruitment process.
 



  





**Application and Contact Information** 




 Scania is collaborating with Sharp Recruitment & Consultants for this recruitment process. For any questions regarding the position or the company, please contact Zarina Virsholm at +46 73 3990727, email: zarin.virsholm@sharpreruitment.se.
 



 Please submit your application at your earliest convenience.

title: Prime Named Account Executive - Digital, Marketing & Commerce Cloud
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

**Prime Named Account Executive - Digital, Marketing & Commerce Cloud**
 Are you ready to drive transformational growth for some of the largest and most strategic customers in Sweden? Salesforce is seeking an exceptional Sales Executive to lead our Marketing Cloud and Commerce Cloud solutions, connecting businesses with the power of digital innovation.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Digital Enterprise Account Executive, you will own and grow a portfolio of enterprise accounts and high-potential prospects within the Marketing and Commerce Cloud space. This role is pivotal in driving revenue growth and fostering trusted relationships with senior stakeholders, acting as a strategic advisor to maximize the value of their digital investments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Ownership and Growth: Manage a defined set of enterprise accounts, driving adoption and growth of Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Commerce Cloud solutions.
* Sales Leadership: Lead end-to-end sales cycles, engaging with CMOs, CDOs, and other senior decision-makers to align Salesforce solutions with customer challenges.
* Strategic Advisor: Act as a trusted advisor, understanding customer needs and aligning them with Salesforce capabilities to deliver measurable business outcomes.
* Collaboration: Work closely with Solution Engineers, Customer Success teams, and Product specialists to craft tailored solutions and ensure customer success.
* Performance Excellence: Meet or exceed revenue targets and performance metrics consistently.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proven Expertise: A seasoned Enterprise Account Executive with a strong track record in digital marketing, ecommerce, or cloud-based solutions.
* Drive and Agility: Thrive in a dynamic, high-performance environment where learning and growth are paramount.
* Strategic Thinking: Ability to navigate complex sales environments and deliver compelling ROI-based proposals.
* Passion for Innovation: Enthusiasm for technology and innovation, from marketing strategies to digital commerce architecture.
* Team Player: Collaborative mindset with a passion for working in a fast-paced, evolving team environment.


 Join us at Salesforce and become a key player in shaping the future of digital enterprise solutions in Sweden. Apply now and let’s drive success together!
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: SAP landskapsarkitekt
description:
Livscykelhantering och underhåll av SAP-miljön är kritiskt för att bibehålla stabila och säkra Betalningsprocesser, Bokföring och Myndighetsrapportering.
   

  

 Konsulten ingår i vårt SAP-team med ansvar för SAP landskapen för portal, SRM, SRM, BW, CUA, PI, SolMan, ERP och CD/RI. I nära dialog med team, andra delar av IT, verksamhet och Driftsleverantör planerar och genomförs test och produktionssättning enligt en fastställd livscykelplan.
   

  

 Rollen ställer krav på flera års erfarenhet av SAP landskapsarkitektur och livscykelhantering av SAP landskapen, stark kommunikativ förmåga och erfarenhet från att leda tekniska initiativ.
   

  

 Det är fördel om man har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Integrationer med PI, Apache Kafka
* Säkerhet
* Fioria
* Arkivering med bl.a. IBM Content Mgr


**Omfattning: 60-100%**
**Språk: Svenska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Chief Revenue Officer
description:
**Oneflow is a rapidly growing tech scale-up located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into customer-oriented, digital contracts that feel like magic.** 




  





**Who you are** 




 We’re looking for a revenue leader who can design and operate an efficient ARR engine while understanding the unique challenges and opportunities of a scaling SaaS business. The ideal candidate will effectively work towards combining the strengths of sales, product, and marketing, driving several types of business funnels tailored for different customer segments, different life cycle stages and different monetisation strategies.
 



  





 Oneflow is neither a sales or marketing first company, nor a product first company. We are a company who understands that true business efficiency comes from an in-depth knowledge of how these forces interconnect to create cohesive approaches to customer acquisition, retention, and business expansion. We therefore believe that you have extensive experience in aligning revenue strategies with data-driven, customer-centric product development methodologies.
 



  





**Skills and experience** 




  




* At least 10 years of experience in Revenue Team and Business Strategic Leadership, with a strong track record of success at the founder, C-suite, or VP level.
* A deep understanding of market dynamics, including customer behaviours, competitive landscapes, and emerging trends.
* Expertise in revenue growth levers such as pricing strategies, sales optimisation, customer acquisition and retention and channel management.
* Demonstrated experience scaling revenue in high-growth software companies, preferably SaaS.
* Expertise in modern sales methodologies, including MEDDIC, and familiarity with leading-edge sales technology stacks.
* Experience in and a deep understanding of sales-led, marketing-led, partner-led and product-led go-to-market strategies, including how they interconnect to create a cohesive and effective approach to customer acquisition, retention, and growth.
* Proven success in leading global teams across multiple international markets is a merit.
* Strong background in analytics and financial modeling as it pertains to revenue strategy, and forecasting across departments.
* Proven ability to navigate organizational transformations and scale rapidly growing teams.
* Fluency in English is required.
* Bachelor / Masters degree in a relevant subject.



  





**Personality & Leadership** 




  




* Embodies and champions Oneflow’s core values: In It Together, Show Love, In Transparency We Trust, Beat Yesterday, Work Wonders.
* Motivated and dynamic individual with unwavering determination to achieve success. Rigorous, meticulous, driven and entrepreneurial.
* A global mindset with cultural sensitivity and adaptability.
* Absolute commitment to excellence and a “best of the best” standard.
* Exceptional ability to drive growth and optimize customer value.
* A charismatic and motivational leader with a proven track record of building high-performing teams.
* Strong numerical and abstract thinking skills; able to synthesize complex data into actionable strategies.
* A forward-thinking leader with the ability to navigate and capitalize on the dynamics of the SaaS landscape.
* Skilled at working cross-functionally and engaging with customers and diverse stakeholders at all levels.



  





**Areas of Responsibility** 




  




* The CRO will be responsible for driving revenue across the organization, overseeing revenue-generating functions such as Sales, Post Sales (Success), Partnership, Marketing & Channel Development and Revenue Operations.
* The CRO will work closely with the management team to align Oneflow’s growth strategies with overall business objectives.
* Manage revenue growth of all new markets/subsidiaries.
* The CRO will own ARR related metrics and will drive KPIs like:



 -Annual Revenue Growth (aligned with ARR targets)
 



 -New Business Acquisition Rate and Pipeline Health
 



 -Customer Retention and Net Revenue Retention (NRR)
 



 -Sales Efficiency Metrics, e.g. Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) and Life Time Value (LTV)
 



 -Performance and Engagement Scores of Revenue Teams
 



  





**Overall Goals of the Role** 




  




* Develop and execute a comprehensive revenue strategy that builds and aligns with Oneflow’s GTM product strategy and supports Oneflow’s company’s growth targets and long-term vision.
* Build and maintain a high-performing, collaborative, and accountable revenue/sales and marketing teams across all regions and functions.
* Align Oneflow’s revenue strategy with its core values to foster a culture of teamwork, innovation, and transparency.
* Oversee the design and implementation of scalable sales processes, playbooks, and KPIs, leveraging modern sales stacks and methodologies, such as MEDDIC.
* Ensure data-driven decision-making through advanced analytics and reporting capabilities.
* Optimize the customer lifecycle from lead acquisition through renewal and expansion, ensuring high customer satisfaction and retention rates.
* Manage the Marketing team and align marketing campaigns and lead generation efforts with sales strategies.
* Partner closely with CPO to align revenue tactics with product, data and customer centric development methodologies.
* Work with the CFO to manage revenue forecasting, budgeting, and performance tracking.
* Act as a key advisor to the CEO on revenue-related initiatives, identifying opportunities for innovation and growth.
* Work closely with top management to set business strategy, establish focus, and ensure alignment across all departments.
* Inspire and develop the next generation of leaders within the revenue organization, creating a strong talent pipeline.
* Foster a result-driven culture of excellence, accountability, collaboration, and innovation that reflects Oneflow’s core values.
* Attract, retain, and nurture world-class talent across all revenue functions.



  





**Come work with us** 




 We value gender equality and diversity in organisation, so we strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we currently have 34 nationalities and are proud of an extremely diverse workplace. Our recruitment is based on competence.
 



  





**We can’t wait to meet you! 🎉** 




 Visit our website for more information about our product and Oneflow. Visit our career page for more information about our culture and future colleagues. 💜

title: Brand Manager Content & Communication
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as a Brand Manager Integrated Marketing**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Brand Manager Integrated Marketing** 
 for our Inhalable categories who will effectively contribute to defining the brand strategy for IQOS and VEEV in the Nordic markets and drive the execution of brand plans and developments, which will enable us to fuel our journey towards a smoke-free future even faster.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 In this role you will be deploying the smoke-free Inhalable category brand communication campaigns and initiatives that drives brand growth and visibility, act upon consumer insights to deliver initiatives that strengthen the consumer journey. You will act as the brand guardian, securing brand consistency through messaging, visuals, and activations – to deliver a strong and consistent brand experience through commercial programs, projects, and initiatives whilst ensuring relevancy to local market(s) and consumer context.
   

  

**Your “day to day**
* Independently lead the development and execution of high-quality, omni-channel toolboxes, campaigns, and activations together with cross-functional teams including both local and global stakeholders.
* Conduct post-campaign follow-up and analysis, and translate insights into actions.
* Conduct thorough analysis of market research and consumer insights to identify trends, behaviors, needs and preferences, and competitive landscape to define business opportunities/business issues.
* Coordinate, align, co-develop brand activities with relevant markets to secure integration in the market’s deployment strategies, following trade processes and market regulatory framework; subsequently prepare comprehensive brand plans to realize the strategy.
* Together with Manager Integrated Marketing, develop Annual Brand Plans and participate in the Long-Range-Plans development to address major business opportunities/issues identified through analysis and feed into the Original Budget / Long Range Plan.
* Develop, plan, and deliver the trans-creation of global toolboxes and campaigns. Collaborate closely with channel owners to ensure relevancy and fit for the channel roles and objectives, driving brand and product performance across channels in respective markets.
* Lead and handle assigned initiatives and projects.


**Who You Ar**
* Minimum 6+ years in Marketing, preferably in FMCG in an international environment.
* University degree in Marketing, business administrations or similar field.
* Documented experience of having successfully worked with brand communication and activations, or related roles, preferably within the FMCG industry.
* Very good strategic height and analytical ability but can work with details when required.
* Strong leadership skills with proven knowledge of effective informal leadership.
* Strong project management skills; structured and self-driven working style.
* Strong communication, presentation, and storytelling skills in both Swedish and English.


 All applicants must have the legal right to work in Sweden
   

  

 Please note that relocation support is not available for this job.
   

  

**What We Offe**
 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join Swedish Match and you too can
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future


 #SWMA
   

  

**12043**

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 To succeed in our mission to create a great product experience, we are building a world-class Product Design Team — that can lead us into the unknown future of the Mentimeter product, fuelled by our desire to challenge tomorrow’s presentation and meeting experiences. We already have a great team in place, and we want to continue to learn and evolve as we grow.
   

  

**Senior Product Designer - Two Open Positions**
 Joining as a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 means applying your broad design skill set in a cross-functional product team—collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, User Research, Data and other roles across the company. You’ll help shape the user experience in your part of the product, contribute to key product decisions, and raise the bar on design execution.
   

  

 The role includes helping your team discover and build great user experiences, contributing to shared design practices, and being a thoughtful partner across disciplines. You’ll be involved in both improving and iterating on existing experiences, as well as exploring new opportunities and long-term directions for the product. The work is hands-on and varied, combining interface design, systems thinking, working with hypotheses and a strong user perspective. We are looking for someone who is passionate about bringing true value to our users, collaborates well with others and ensures the work they do is at the highest level of craft and execution.
   

  

 We believe in the power of the empowered product team. Our organization is built to enable high alignment, outcome focus, and strong support from leadership—so that you and your team can do great work. Both of these roles are based in our Stockholm office, and you’ll have the ability to work from home or remotely two days per week.
   

  

 We’re hiring for
 **two roles:** 
 one in our
 **Commercial area** 
 , and one in our
 **Core** 
**area**
* Senior Product Designer in the Commercial area


 In the Commercial area, you’ll work on growth-focused initiatives that help users discover and adopt the value in Mentimeter—guiding them from free to paid, and from individuals to teams. This includes onboarding, activation, habit formation, monetization, fueling network effects and making it easier for teams to adopt Mentimeter across their organization.
   

  

 Your work will support both product-led growth and our Enterprise offering, helping ensure our customers succeed and scale with us. You’ll work hypothesis-driven and design flows like sign-up, onboarding, upgrades, team invites, and feature education—always balancing user experience with business goals.
   

  

 This is a great fit if you have experience in
 **B2B SaaS** 
 ,
 **product-led growth** 
**and experimentation** 
 ..
