title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Engineering Manager – Help Us Build Something Great** 




 📍
 *Full-Time | Hybrid | Stockholm* 




  





 A customer of ours based in Stockholm is currently looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to join their team. This is a full-time, permanent position working in the office in Stockholm.
 



  





 They’re a product-driven company building scalable, thoughtful software — and they’re now looking for someone to lead and scale their core engineering team. This is a hands-on leadership role with a focus on coaching, delivery, and creating a healthy, high-performing team culture.
 



  





**About the Role:** 



* Lead a small, experienced team of engineers — mentoring, unblocking, and supporting their development
* Work closely with Product and Design to shape ideas and deliver high-quality solutions
* Maintain strong standards around code quality, technical design, and long-term maintainability
* Play a key role in hiring and scaling the team in a thoughtful, sustainable way
* Foster a culture of trust, ownership, and continuous improvement



  





**What They’re Looking For:** 



* Previous experience managing engineering teams, ideally in a fast-moving product environment
* Strong technical background — confident in architecture discussions, code reviews, and mentoring engineers
* Experience working with modern development practices (CI/CD, Agile, Cloud, etc.)
* Clear communication skills and a collaborative, people-first approach
* Someone who genuinely cares about building great teams, not just shipping features



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Hands-on experience as a software engineer (any tech stack)
* Background in startups or scale-ups
* Exposure to hiring, technical strategy, or org design



  





**Details:** 



* 📍 Location: Stockholm (Hybrid)
* 💼 Type: Full-time, Permanent
* 💰 Competitive salary + benefits package + Options/warrants
* 🌍 International team, English-speaking environment



  





 If this sounds like a good fit, or if you'd like to hear more about the company and the team, feel free to get in touch. We’re happy to share more details and talk through the role.

title: Document Controller
company_industry: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Company Description**
 At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.
   

  

 Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 130 countries worldwide.
   

  

 Our team is dynamic, innovative, and client-focused, supported by an inclusive and fun company culture. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result, our people get to enjoy working on some of the most exciting projects in the world.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are currently seeking to recruit a Document Controller to join our Digital team. This varied and challenging role will involve working with internal and Client document control teams. Initiative and problem-solving skills are necessary, as are strong interpersonal and communication skills, experience using control procedures, and using Common Data Environments (CDE) and specifically Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC).
   

  

 Our Digital Division is a highly successful and growing business unit, and as a result we are seeking to recruit a high performing, document controller to enjoy a long term, successful career as we continue to be appointed on some of Europe’s most prestigious projects.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Implementation and Management of CDE / EDMS – To provide support for the implementation and roll-out of a document management system. Act as the main point of contact for all queries and requests relating to the system. Undertake day to day user account and project site management.
* Document Quality Control - Compliance monitoring of incoming and outgoing documents into the system, making sure that documents are in the correct format and with the correct metadata. Provide guidance of file naming protocols and assist users to move or rename any incorrectly uploaded files.
* Provide CDE / EDMS training – Organise and undertake regular training sessions on the purpose and use of the system for new users and refresher training for existing users. Create and maintain training logs. Prepare and update training packs, system user guides and quick reference sheets.
* Project Communication – Management of project related documents, correspondence and RFI’s via the CDE / EDMS. Scope and design required workflows to enable project processes.
* Information Packages - Support the assembly of information packages and check package completeness during design review and approval process to the relevant person and report on adherence to timescales form a defined standard.
* Respond to ad-hoc requests relating to document management/CDE – Provide ad-hoc advice and guidance on use of the CDE / EDMS system and associated user guides and policy documents. Provide ad-hoc reports and information on system usage and compliance.


**Qualifications**
**Essential Skills & Experience**
* Experience in working with Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC)
* Experienced Document Controller with 2+ year’s relevant experience.
* Expert user level experience using OpenText is preferred or at least one of the following: Aconex, ViewPoint/4P, Asite, Projectwise or Autodesk Construction Cloud/BIM360
* Skilled in presenting to groups and delivering training in a variety of mediums.
* Ability to stay on focus and carry out tasks in a timely and accurate manner.
* Migrating data between systems.
* Uploading and cataloguing documents.
* Developing excellent working relationships with the client and contractors/consultants involved in the provision of services.


**Desirable Skills & Experience**
* Experience in engaging with stakeholders to define requirements for workflows and processes and ability to implement these within the chosen CDE / EDMS.
* Administrator level experience using at least one of the following: OpenText ECM, Aconex, ViewPoint/4P, Asite, ACC/BIM360, ProjectWise, smino or ThinkProjectCDE.
* Understanding of Building Information Modelling (BIM) in the context of Information Management and Document Control.


**Salary & Benefits**
 Remuneration will be dependent on experience and qualifications, but the package will consist of an attractive base salary plus benefits.
   

  

 We actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Our colleagues share our vision and mission. We offer a workplace where every person has the opportunity and voice to influence and change.
   

  

 We want our people to succeed both at work and in their private lives. To support this, we promote a healthy, productive and flexible work environment that respects work-life balance.
   

  

 Turner & Townsend stands for a level playing field. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as well as actively encouraging applications from all parts of society.
   

  

 Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/
   

  

 Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:
   

  

 Twitter
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.
   

  

 Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.
   

  

 Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:
   

  

 Twitter
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

*It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.*
*Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.*

title: Engagement Manager, ProServe EMEA North
job_function: Project Management, Management, and Product Management
description:
****DESCRIPTION****
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a highly skilled and versatile Engagement Manager (EM) to join our team and lead the delivery of complex cloud solution projects. In this role you will combine technical expertise with strong project leadership skills to drive successful implementations of AWS-based solutions for our clients. You will bridge business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating technical discussions and ensuring alignment with customer outcomes. Applying AWS frameworks like Well-Architected and Cloud Adoption Framework while demonstrating technical credibility across diverse stakeholders, you will distill customer needs into clear technical requirements, decompose complex problems, and make informed trade-off decisions considering performance, scalability, security, and business impact. Possessing strong technology and program/project management experience, you will validate technical solutions against business goals, recognize when additional technical evaluation is needed, and manage technical risks. You will be expected to achieve and maintain relevant AWS certifications, develop domain-specific expertise, and effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and business audiences. As you progress, you’ll lead increasingly complex technical projects, shape cross-organizational technical strategies, and establish best practices in your domain. In this role you will apply your management and leadership capabilities to successfully execute project plans, proactively identify and manage risks, resolve issues, escalate when appropriate, and drive projects to successful completion, while exceeding customer expectation The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology program/project manager, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading and managing complex cloud migration and implementation projects
* Leveraging comprehensive knowledge of AWS services, architectures, and best practices to guide technical decisions and strategic planning  Bridging business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating engineering discussions and ensuring alignment with customer business outcomes
* Distilling customer needs into clear technical requirements and map them to business outcomes - Decomposing complex technical problems into actionable, deliverable solutions
* Contributing to technical documentation and define documentation standards


**About The Team**
 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences:
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

**Inclusive Team Culture:**
 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

**Mentorship & Career Growth:**
 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

****BASIC QUALIFICATIONS****
* 5+ years Project Management hands-on experience in managing and delivering enterprise level IT projects, with external customers or equivalent experience
* Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple and concurrent projects/customers.
* Led teams and engagements utilizing agile approaches, value and principles as well as Scrum framework
* Understands the value proposition of cloud services and has delivered cloud engagements and experience with Agile and Project Management (APM) toolsets (Jira, RallyDev, VersionOne, Taiga, etc and Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience.


****PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS****
* Has at least one active project management certification (e.g., APM, CSM, PMI-ACP, PRINCE2)
* Managed technical projects consisting of 4 or more people totaling over $500,000 budget
* Managed and delivered IT engagements for Nordic large enterprise customers.
* Managed engagements using Agile/Iterative methodologie and possesses a deep knowledge of Agile and Scaled program management best practices and how to pragmatically apply across large, complex projects.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2924125

title: Senior Bid Manager
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vill du vara med och vinna några av marknadens mest komplexa outsourcingaffärer? Nu söker vi en
 **Senior Bid Manager** 
 som vill ta ledande ansvar i både nationella och internationella upphandlingar – och driva affärskritiska projekt i nära samarbete med våra expertteam och kunder.
   

  

 Som Senior Bid Manager kommer du att spela en central roll i vårt bid-team, där du leder stora och komplexa anbudsprojekt inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Du ansvarar för att skapa en vinnande strategi, samordna tvärfunktionella team och säkerställa att alla delar av processen håller högsta kvalitet – från första analys till kontraktssignering.
   

  

 Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med såväl tjänsteägare och säljledning internt som partners, underleverantörer och internationella bid-team inom Sopra Steria-koncernen.
   

  

**Ditt ansvar – några nyckelområden**
 I rollen som Senior Bid Manager har du det övergripande ansvaret för att leda hela anbudsprocessen – från uppstart till kontraktssignering. Du säkerställer att rätt kompetenser är involverade, bemannar teamet med interna resurser, hanterar externa partners och ser till att alla delar av processen håller hög kvalitet. Du driver kommunikationen internt och externt, coachar teamet, ansvarar för dokumentation och för att alla krav uppfylls. Dessutom bidrar du till förhandlingsstrategier och etablerar strukturerade arbetssätt för planering, uppföljning och beslutsfattande – alltid med fokus på affärsnytta och ett konkurrenskraftigt slutresultat.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
 Du är en erfaren och affärsdriven bid- eller projektledare med ett skarpt öga för både detaljer och helhet. Du drivs av att vinna affärer och har en naturlig förmåga att få team att leverera mot gemensamma mål – även under press.
   

  

**Du har:**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att leda större upphandlingar och komplexa anbudsprocesser
* God förståelse för LOU/LUF, affärsutveckling och kommersiella villkor
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i och mot IT-driftorganisationer, gärna med inslag av nearshore/Xshore
* Ekonomisk och analytisk förståelse för prissättning och kostnadskalkyler
* Förmåga att producera tydliga, kvalitativa beslutsunderlag och presentationer
* Gärna erfarenhet av att använda AI-stöd för anbudskvalificering och textanalys


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi tror att du är:
   

  

* Strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och självgående
* Van att samarbeta med många olika roller och att kommunicera tydligt
* Affärsmässig, engagerad och har en stark vinnarmentalitet
* Nyfiken, driven och ständigt intresserad av att utvecklas
* Flytande i både svenska och engelska, då du kommer att verka i en internationell miljö.


**Övrigt**
 Rollen rapporterar direkt till vår VD och innebär ett nära samarbete med både den svenska organisationen och våra internationella kollegor. Placering är flexibel – du kan utgå från något av våra kontor, och viss resor förekommer, främst inom Sverige.
   

  

**Hos oss får du**
* En nyckelroll i ett av Europas mest spännande digitaliseringsbolag
* Möjlighet att driva strategiska affärer som gör verklig skillnad
* Ett stöttande team och ett internationellt nätverk fullt av smarta kollegor
* En kultur som präglas av självledarskap, samarbete och kunskapsdelning
* Stora möjligheter till utveckling – både professionellt och personligt
* Ett bolag där vi faktiskt tror på att ha kul på jobbet – vi gillar att skratta, fira framgångar (små som stora) och bygga relationer som håller
* Och ja, det finns både kaffe, pingisbord och riktigt bra after works – men det som gör oss unika är att vi bryr oss på riktigt om både våra kunder och varandra


**Hur söker du?**
 Sök nu genom att klicka på ”Ansök” på denna sida eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto via annonsen på vår hemsida! Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Marie Kallin, Marie.Kallin@soprasteria.com, Team lead Bid Office Sverige.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Directory Services Architect
description:
**Epical is a pure-play data consultancy with services and expertise to support and enable the management, utilization and protection of our clients' data. We're not just experts in data; we're trust-makers who empower our clients to exceed expectations. Join us in our mission to empower organizations through secure and efficient digital identity management, while fostering a culture of empathy, accountability, and curiosity.** 




  





**What is this role all about?** 




  





 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Directory Services Architect** 
 to join our Digital Trust team. As a Directory Services Architect, you will have overall responsibility for implementing identity solutions and directories such as Active Directory, federation, authentication, and authorization for identities and devices. To succeed in the role, you have prior experience in implementing the above technologies and concepts in larger, complex environments with high-security requirements and a solid understanding of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in the context of these technologies and products.
 



  





**Key** 
**responsibilities:** 




  




* Creating designs for technical implementations, in regard to the customers’ requirements and demands
* Manage the deliveries of both architectural and technical solutions and that solution proposals can be implemented in practice
* Be aware and kept up to date with common vulnerabilities and threats within the identity domain and be able to mitigate them both in design choices and in the implementation of technical solutions
* Collaborate on team-level but still being comfortable taking own initiatives to drive your own work and projects forward
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices within Directory Services and the identity domain
* Ensure security standards and regulatory requirements are being considered in customer deliveries



  





 The role is a full-time position, and you can live anywhere in Sweden or in Finland as we apply remote work culture, depending on customer assignments. We do have 10 centrally located offices in different cities across Sweden and Finland.
 



  





**Are you our next trust-maker?** 




  





 To succeed in this role, you should have...
 



  




* At least 10 years of technical expertise in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) at an expert level – implementation, design, and securing.
* At least 3 years of experience in designing and implementing the Microsoft Legacy Tier Model or Enterprise Access Model with Privilege Access Workstations (PAWs).
* A minimum of 5 completed projects related to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
* At least 3 completed projects related to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) and security where a tier model has been implemented – the most recent not older than 2018.
* At least 3 years of experience with Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in relation to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) – as well as Smart Card or Yubikey authentication.
* At least 3 years of technical expertise and understanding of DNS.
* Excellent knowledge of Windows Server and Windows Client, Group Policy, and advanced troubleshooting.
* Good knowledge of authentication/authorization protocols such as NTLM, Kerberos, SAML, OAuth2, and OIDC.
* Good knowledge of network segmentation and IPSec in Windows Firewall (Domain and Server Isolation) and 802.1x.
* Fluent in English, speaking and writing



  





**Strongly** 
**merited skills** 




  




* Previous experience in the design, implementation, and troubleshooting of Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS).
* Previous experience in the design, implementation, and troubleshooting of Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS).
* Previous experience with VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF) in relation to authentication and authorization (ESXi, vCenter, vIDM, NSX-T Manager).
* Knowledge of PowerShell and .NET Framework for automating identity and Active Directory-related tasks (System.Directory Services.).
* Previous experience with Thales Luna HSM and/or Thales CipherTrust Manager.
* Previous experience with SecMaker/PointSharp’s NetID Portal.
* Previous experience with Microsoft Entra ID
* Previous experience with Identity and Access Management (IAM) solutions.
* Previous experience designing solutions for Operational Technology (OT) environments.
* At least 1 year of experience within project(s) involving security-sensitive operations.
* Fluency in Swedish or Finnish in both speaking and writing



  





 As a Directory Services Architect, we expect you to have great analytical skills, pay attention to detail, and possess strong communication and collaboration skills. You are curious, commit to continuous development and learning as well as you are adaptable to change.
 



  





**What do we offer?** 




  




* A chance to join a team of the Nordic region’s leading experts in Digital Trust, where curiosity is encouraged, and sharing knowledge is a priority.
* Engaging and challenging hands-on assignments, collaborating with large global clients in complex environments.
* A supportive organization that values accountability, while also promoting work-life balance and offering the flexibility to work remotely.
* A comprehensive compensation and benefits package.
* Ongoing opportunities for education and growth. Access to Visual Studio Enterprise Subscription and Azure/O365 lab environment, courses and certifications to fuel your curiosity and professional development.



  





  





**Let’s secure the Nordic’s together, one step at a time 🔐** 




 We cannot wait to see your application today! Selection will take place on an ongoing basis.
 



**To qualify for this role, you need to live and have a residence, as well as a citizenship/work permit in Sweden or Finland.** 
 If you have any questions regarding the role, please do not hesitate to contact me. I can be reached at pia.leskinen@epicalgroup.com.
 



  





***Our expertise is data. Our product is trust.***




 We’re epical.
 



 And you’re welcome to join us.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:

* Hybrid


**Job Description**
**What you'll get to do**
 You'll play a pivotal role in moving our new frontend forward, collaborating closely with your team to deliver innovative solutions that delight our users. You´ll team up with frontenders in the team to drive all of our technical projects on the Frontend side and create the best possible plattform for Detectify and our customers. You'll work in a cloud-first environment, leveraging your expertise to create scalable and performant applications that make a significant impact on our product and the user experience.
   

  

 We foster an enabling and empowered culture where you'll have the freedom to utilize your full skill set and express your unique personality. We encourage open, passionate discussions to fuel our collective learning and growth, creating a fun and engaging environment where your contributions are valued.

 , you'll contribute to the entire development cycle: ideation to iteration, and everything in between:

* Drive architecture together with your team within your domain and contribute to decisions across teams

 This position is for the Stockholm office.
 *We do not offer remote working or offer relocation for this position*

title: Senior Consultant - BIM
company_industry: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
****Company Description****
 At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.
   

  

 Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 130 countries worldwide.
   

  

 Our team is dynamic, innovative, and client-focused, supported by an inclusive and fun company culture. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result, our people get to enjoy working on some of the most exciting projects in the world.
   

  

****Job Description****
 Our team are recognised as global experts in the development and deployment of BIM on major projects and programmes, delivering client outcomes which mutually benefit the supply chain and add value to projects.
   

  

**The Approach Underpinning Our Delivery Is:**
* Forward thinking
* Careful planning
* Shared understanding
* Transparency and collaboration
* Independent and open methodology


 We work holistically with our wider business to provide an environment for innovation and deliver success on projects where BIM is core to the delivery and operation of assets.
   

  

 We lead the BIM process at organisational, programme and project level through:
   

  

* Discovery and understanding
* Client adoption strategy and strategic project setup
* Project and programme BIM execution planning
* BIM implementation, information management and supply chain management
* BIM compliance checking and data verification


 Our specialist staff work globally, using cutting edge tools and techniques to deliver the vision of the world’s best clients.
   

  

**Our team are recognised as global experts in the development and deployment of BIM on major projects and programmes, delivering client outcomes which mutually benefit the supply chain and add value to projects.**
**The Approach Underpinning Our Delivery Is:**
* Forward thinking
* Careful planning
* Shared understanding
* Transparency and collaboration
* Independent and open methodology


 We work holistically with our wider business to provide an environment for innovation and deliver success on projects where BIM is core to the delivery and operation of assets.
   

  

 We lead the BIM process at organisational, programme and project level through:
   

  

* Discovery and understanding
* Client adoption strategy and strategic project setup
* Project and programme BIM execution planning
* BIM implementation, information management and supply chain management
* BIM compliance checking and data verification


 Our specialist staff work globally, using cutting edge tools and techniques to deliver the vision of the world’s best clients.
   

  

****Job Summary****
 Turner & Townsend GmbH are looking for an exceptional Senior Consultant to join our growing team. The successful applicant will help implement BIM on behalf of our clients in Sweden and across Europe and being responsible for project delivery
   

  

 Specific duties
   

  

* Leading and supporting our team in the implementation of BIM on major projects, programmes and across portfolios.
* Authoring of key BIM documentation such as Asset Information Requirements, Employer Information Requirements and where applicable, BIM Execution Plans.
* Assessing project teams BIM competency, advising the development of the project BIM Execution Plans and approving on behalf of Client where necessary.
* Assure project BIM standards are being followed by project stakeholders reporting key risks and effective mitigations.
* Lead model assurance activities including; definition of strategy and approach, model analysis, technical and plain language reporting.
* Chair and lead BIM workgroup and Technical BIM sessions with the project team to present outcomes of model assurance activities.
* Research, develop and implement areas of new technology, process and emerging best practices.
* Continuingly develop in-house standards and capabilities.
* Provide support to the wider business with tender bidding teams to win future work.


****Qualifications****
**Skills and Experience**
 Typically, a qualified professional in a relevant discipline, five or more year’s relevant experience in a BIM environment is a key component of the role. The applicant should be familiar with ISO 19650 and other relevant local standards/guidelines. We are looking for someone to be an enthusiastic, proactive self-starters with well-developed communications and analytical skills.
   

  

 Previous Experience Working In a BIM Environment On a Major Project, Programme Or Across a Large Portfolio Would Be Ideal, Evidence Of BIM Courses And Modules Would Strengthen Your Application. Expected To Be Numerate And Computer Literate, Competent In At Least One Of The Following ‘model Checking’ And ‘model Authoring’ Software’s:
   

  

* Autodesk Navisworks
* Autodesk Construction Cloud/ BIM360
* Solibri Model Checker
* Graphisoft ArchiCAD
* Bentley AECOsim
* Nemetschek Vectorworks
* Autodesk Revit


 You will work with us to develop your technical and management skills through project experience, training and mentorship.
   

  

**Core competencies**
* Enthusiastic and positive team player - Giving the project team confidence in the use of BIM
* Excellent Communicator – ability to provide clear guidance to the whole project team, in order to coordinate a successful outcome
* Experience in writing clear, concise requirements and documentation.
* Have an understanding of design, BIM and procurement, and its application in planning and construction management
* Have an understanding of BIM Competency Assessments of supply chains
* Proven systematic approach to problem solving and model development protocols
* Proven experience in multidisciplinary working practices and interdependencies
* Proven client facing experience
* Up to date knowledge of BIM technology and interoperability standards / good all-round technical knowledge and enthusiasm


****Additional Information****
 Our colleagues share our vision and mission. We offer a workplace where every person has the opportunity and voice to influence and change.
   

  

 We want our people to succeed both at work and in their private lives. To support this, we promote a healthy, productive and flexible work environment that respects work-life balance.
   

  

 Turner & Townsend stands for a level playing field. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as well as actively encouraging applications from all parts of society.

title: SAP Senior Consultant (Ariba)
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your role:**
 As an SAP Consultant, you will be responsible for optimizing end-to-end processes through SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, and S/4 HANA, helping us improve efficiency, reduce costs, and deliver superior customer service. If you have a track record of implementing and supporting SAP solutions and are a true Team Player that is passionate about adding value to clients and want to advance your career, this could be the role for you!
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Lead and manage the delivery of comprehensive solutions based on SAP Ariba/SAP Business Network for Supply Chain Collaboration.
* Act as a strategic partner to both Ariba and SAP teams, ensuring seamless integration and collaboration.
* Act as an expert in one or more functional areas, including SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, Ariba Upstream and/or Downstream, and Ariba Supplier Lifecycle Management.
* Manage and drive cross-functional teams to successful delivery, ensuring that client requirements are met with efficiency and excellence.


**Your profile:**
* To excel in this role, we seek candidates with proven expertise in one or more of the following components: SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, SAP Ariba Supplier Management, SAP Ariba Contracts, SAP Ariba Integration and Extensions, SAP Ariba Sourcing, SAP Ariba Procurement. Valid certifications add value.
* You should have a strong track record of leading complex Ariba implementations, with the proven ability to manage multiple components effectively and efficiently.
* A passion for business development within the Ariba/SAP Business Network for Supply Chain space is considered a plus, with a knack for identifying new opportunities and driving growth.
* Experience with S/4HANA implementations and upgrades is essential, along with the ability to engage and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels, serving as a trusted strategic advisor.


*Note: Nordic-based and fluency in English; proficiency in local language is preferred. Open to travel.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.
   

  

 With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.

title: Senior/Staff IT SOX (IT GRC) – (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 We are seeking an experienced and proactive Staff IT SOX to oversee and drive our IT compliance initiatives as they relate to Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) regulations. In this pivotal role, you will partner across multiple teams to ensure the design, implementation, and ongoing effectiveness of internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR) in IT systems and processes. You will be a subject matter expert guiding the organization on SOX compliance and lead strategic projects to mitigate technology-related risks.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* SOX Program Leadership: Manage the IT SOX compliance program, including risk assessments, control mapping, and annual scoping.
* Control Design & Evaluation: Review, design, and enhance IT general controls (ITGCs), application controls, and automated business process controls.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with IT, Finance, Internal Audit, and external auditors to coordinate SOX testing and remediation efforts.
* Testing & Documentation: Oversee or perform walkthroughs, test the operating effectiveness of controls, and ensure accurate, comprehensive documentation.
* Remediation & Continuous Improvement: Track issues, lead root cause analysis, and follow up on remediation and preventive actions for SOX deficiencies.
* Awareness & Training: Educate and train IT and business teams on SOX requirements and best practices in IT controls and compliance.
* Process Optimization: Identify and implement process enhancements to strengthen the SOX compliance framework.
* Reporting: Prepare regular reporting and dashboards for management on SOX compliance status, issues, and remediation progress.


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Accounting, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in IT compliance, IT audit, or related roles, with significant SOX experience.
* Deep understanding of SOX Section 404 and ITGCs (e.g., access controls, change management, operations).
* Experience leading audits or SOX compliance programs in a large, complex environment.
* Excellent organizational, project management, and communication skills.
* Professional certifications (CISA, CISSP, CIA, CPA, or similar)
* Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle), cloud platforms, or complex IT environments


 Join us and live where other people go for vacation. Here are some of the
 **benefits** 
 offered by Agoda.
   

  

* Hybrid Working model
* WFH setup allowance
* 30-day remote working from anywhere globally, every year.
* Employee discount for accommodation globally
* Global team of 85+ nationalities
* 40+ offices in 25+ countries
* Annual CSR/Volunteer time off
* Benevity subscription for employee donations
* Volunteering opportunities globally
* Free headspace, Odilo & Udemy subscription
* Access to employee assistance program (third party for personal and workplace support)
* Enhanced Parental leave
* Life, TPD & Accident Insurance


 Our amazing People Team will take care of the visa process and flights + a shipment and the first 30 days of accommodation in Bangkok.

title: Group Accountant - Norwegian speaking
description:
**About Us** 




**nShift** 
 is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 460 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.
 



 Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!
 



 If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.
 



  





**Purpose of Role** 




 As a Group Accountant within the Group Finance Team at nShift, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the timeliness and accuracy of monthly closings and meeting the Group’s statutory compliance obligations. Your expertise in Norwegian financial regulations and fluency in the language will position you as the go-to specialist for our Norwegian entities.
 



 Working closely with the Group Financial Controller, you will support the preparation of annual financial statements, tax returns, and regulatory reporting across the group. Your contribution will be integral to delivering high-quality financial reporting, driving continuous improvement, and building a high-performing, collaborative finance team within our international organization.
 



  





**About You** 




 You are a detail-oriented and analytical finance professional, driven by a desire for continuous improvement and operational excellence. You thrive under pressure, manage multiple deadlines effectively, and demonstrate strong initiative and problem-solving abilities. Pragmatic, hands-on, and highly organized, you bring a collaborative mindset and a can-do attitude to every task.
 



  





**The area of responsibility includes:** 



* Ensure timely and accurate month-end close processes, including journal entries, fixed asset depreciation, accruals, and intercompany transactions
* Prepare and maintain balance sheet reconciliations
* Timely submission of VAT returns and compliance with local VAT regulations
* Accurately record personnel costs and support related reporting to Norwegian tax authorities
* Act as the subject matter expert for compliance and regulatory reporting for Norwegian entities
* Assist in the preparation of audit deliverables, statutory financial statements, and tax filings
* Proactively develop and enhance accounting processes and routines
* Provide accounting and system support to team members and stakeholders
* Collaborate with business control, treasury, credit control, and other departments on finance-related matters
* Participate in ad hoc projects and tasks as assigned by senior leadership



  





**Competence and experience:** 



* Fluency in Norwegian and English is essential
* Bachelor's degree or higher in Finance, Accounting, or a related field
* Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in accounting or financial control
* Strong understanding of Norwegian GAAP, VAT regulations, and tax compliance
* Demonstrated experience in preparing financial statements and tax documentation
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience with NetSuite or other cloud-based ERP systems is a plus



  





 \*Please submit your CV in English\*
 



  





**Meet your manager:** 
 Chay Nuttall - Group Financial Controller
 



**How long have you worked for nShift?** 




 I joined back in August 2024.
 



**What do you love about nShift?** 




 I love the people in the organisation. Everyone has an openness and willingness to support and help. The business is also a great place for internal development and career progression
 



**What difference will this role make to nShift if I join?** 




 You will be a valued member of our team both professionally and personally and contribute to high-quality reporting in nShift Group
 



  





 At nShift, we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone, which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal opportunity employer, meaning all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.

title: Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**
 We are looking for a
 **Strategic Product Manager** 
 who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Banking you will work on:**
* Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and mid-term/long-term strategy that aligns with the company's overall Strategy, objectives and market trends. Define target customers, licensing and pricing models to address predictable long-term revenue flow. Define complementary services to support successful implementation and maintenance, ensure additional revenue flow.
* Market Analysis: Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends, competitive landscape, regulatory changes and customer needs, providing input and recommendations for strategic decisions for mid-term and long-term initiatives. Identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
* Roadmap Development: Ability to translate market needs and business opportunities to a strategic roadmap and balance long/short-term needs. Create and maintain a high-level product roadmap that outlines key milestones, deliverables, and timelines, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Address product lifecycles, including planning sunsetting and migration strategies. Define innovation inception approaches. Plan portfolio modernization to fit market needs, ensure future growth and competitive costs.
* Relationship Building: Establish and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and industry influencers to create new business opportunities. Participate, present and be influencer in conferences, industry workgroups. Build relationships with industry stakeholders globally. Demonstrate cultural awareness and the ability to adapt product strategies to various regional requirements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with other departments, including engineering, marketing, project management and customer teams, to support with sales and ensure successful product development and launch. Cooperate cross-units in Cards and Transaction Banking and other units in Banking.
* Customer Insights: Prepare and present vision, pitches, and presentations to existing and potential clients and partners, effectively communicating the value proposition. Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and enhance user experience.
* Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* Leadership and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.


**Who we are looking for:**
* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.


**We also believe you have:**
* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Rīga - Verde, Roberta Hirša 1
   

  

*On specific positions, we might perform background checks.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Test Engineer
description:
**About this role:**



We are looking for a Test Engineer to join our busy Production team in Gothenburg. The role is site-based given the nature of the work.



This opportunity is ideal for someone looking to provide expertise in testing for manufacturing products for hardware to cost, quality, safety and timescales.



You will enjoy working in a production role in a dynamic working environment. You will have relevant work experience with the desire to grow your knowledge and expertise while adding value to our current ways of working. You will not be afraid of challenges and happy to get involved.



It is an exciting opportunity to be part of existing projects where your work literally ends up in space!

  


**Key Responsibilities:**



The role is responsible for conducting tests on our hardware then reporting on results for electronic assemblies and systems.


* Support activities in delivering hardware for projects to expected standards and timescales
* Engage with Project Manager and project reviews to ensure test schedules are in alignment of project timescales
* Produce and communicate with relevant stakeholders regarding progress and status of hardware under test
* Participating in environmental and EMC tests
* Support Design Engineers with testing and debugging both current and new designs
* Verify hardware meets customer requirements
* Suggest and implement improvements for test procedures
* Collate, review and write reports for test results with recommended actions
* Work to company’s quality standards and processes mandated by the customer

  


**Skills required:**


* Relevant degree or equivalent work experience
* Demonstrates competence in electrical and electronic engineering principles
* Evidences knowledge of schematic diagrams and PCB layout to debug hardware
* Working knowledge and understanding of test equipment
* Experience of following test and evaluation plans
* Capability and willingness to write effective test and evaluation plans
* Demonstrates ability to apply test methodology to debug issues
* Demonstrates understanding of Health and Safety and Quality Management Systems
* Ability to work independently as well as effectively collaborate within a multicultural team
* Ability to make good decisions under highly demanding, dynamic environment
* Ability to organise self and prioritise workload in dynamic environment with tight deadlines
* Competent IT skills including Microsoft software
* Proficient in English, both verbally and written

  


**Skills desired:**

* Previous experience working with small/medium sized companies


**ABOUT AAC CLYDE SPACE**



AAC Clyde Space, a leading New Space company, specialises in small satellite technologies and services that enable businesses, governments, and educational organisations to access high-quality, timely data from space. This data has a vast range of applications, from weather forecasting to precision farming to environmental monitoring, and is essential to improving our quality of life on Earth.


**Our growing capabilities bring together three divisions:**

* **Space Data as a Service** – delivering data from space directly to customers
* **Space missions** – turnkey solutions that empower customers to streamline their space missions
* **Space products and components** – a full range of off-the-shelf and tailor-made subsystems, components, and sensors


AAC Clyde Space aims to become a world leader in commercial small satellites and services from space, applying advances in its technology to tackle global challenges and improve our life on Earth.



Some of our clients include Horizon Technologies, Orbcomm, OHB Sweden, Intuitive Machines, Orbital Micro Systems, the United States Airforce Academy, UK Space Agency, European Space Agency and NASA.



AAC Clyde Space Group consists of the parent company AAC Clyde Space AB (publ) and subsidiaries in Sweden, the UK, the Netherlands, South Africa and the USA. Our main operations are in these five countries, with partner networks in Japan and South Korea.



AAC Clyde Space’s share is traded on the Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market.


**Data Protection Policy**



As part of our recruitment process, we collect and process personal data relating to job applicants. We are committed to being transparent about how we collect and use this data, please click here to see our job applicant privacy notice.


**Right to Work**



AAC Clyde Space has a legal responsibility to ensure that all its employees have the legal right to live and work in the EU or the country in which they plan to work. Therefore, if you are made an offer of employment, this will be subject to AAC Clyde Space verifying that you are eligible to work in that country before you start work.


**Equality, Diversity and Inclusion**



We aim to create a positive recruitment and selection experience across every part of our business. The company is committed to handling applications to a consistently high standard and all candidates with dignity and respect. Those involved in the recruitment and selection process will act with integrity, objectivity and professionalism. We are committed to equal opportunities for all and to have diversity reflected within our global workforce. We believe its diversity and inclusion will allow for greater creativity and innovation to help AAC Clyde Space Group deliver the vision to help improve life on earth.


**Openness to Flexible Working**



We recognise work-life balance is important so we are open to discussions around flexible working, depending on the nature of the role and business needs. If you would like to know more, please ask the Hiring Manager during any recruitment process that you may be involved in.

title: Gillar du El ?
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**


Vi vill fortsätta att bygga på vårt lag med kompetenta El konstruktörer i vårat nya bolag Sigma Industry Services.

Vi söker därför efter dig som tillsammans med oss vill vara delaktig i att bygga upp morgondagens teknikkonsultföretag och det bästa laget inom el i Mälardalen.



Som el ingenjör kommer du arbeta tillsammans med de främsta företagen inom svensk industri såsom järnväg, vindkraft, vattenkraft, värme m.fl . Du gillar problemlösning och är kundfokuserad och lyhörd. Utifrån kundens önskemål och din erfarenhet utvecklar du och löser kundens utmaningar.



Som El ingenjör kommer du att jobba bland annat mot både ABB,Volvo,Stadler,Alstom och Westinghouse inom el konstruktion.



Omkring dig kommer du att ha många framgångsrika kollegor och ett aktivt erfarenhetsutbyte inom Sigma. Vi har ett gäng konstruktörer som utgår ifrån Umeå och ett ännu större team som utgår ifrån Stockholm så du har många kollegor att bolla utmaningarna med som jobbat med många olika kunder i olika uppdrag.



Då vi verkar i flertalet branscher kan du också få möjlighet att pröva vingarna på uppdrag utanför din comfort zone, i nya kontexter och med annorlunda teknologi. Hos oss kan du räkna med utmanande och utvecklande projekt!



Summerat:  

* Komplexa tekniska team
* Kontinuerlig kontakt med kunder, leverantörer och interna parter
* Utveckling
* Problemlösning


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Vi söker dig som tycker att det kul att jobba i projektform , som gillar samarbete och har förmågan att kommunicera säkert, tydligt och effektivt. Du har goda kunskaper inom någon/några av nedan områden:



* Elkonstruktion, låg,mellanspänning och högspänning


* Tekniska beskrivningar
* Anläggningskonstruktion
* Arbeta inom projekt med elkonstruktion för industrier
* Konstruktion av kablage
* Arbeta inom CAD systemet E3,elMaster,Autocad eller liknande
* Provning/idrifttagning



Som person är du engagerad och affärsmässig, strävar efter att leverera ditt yttersta och har stor social kompetens. Du är lyhörd för kundens/projektets behov och kan snabbt anpassa dig till kulturen. Du tycker om att knyta nya kontakter och motiveras av såväl självständigt arbete som i team med andra.



Du har sannolikt en ingenjörsutbildning, minst 2års relevant erfarenhet och ett stort intresse för teknik, kommunikation och utveckling. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och bygga det vassaste konsultlaget!



### **WE OFFER**



 Vi är oerhört stolta över att Sigma Industry East North Group har blivit rankad som #2 på listan: Svergies Bästa Arbetsgivare 2024 i kategorin små- till medelstora arbetsgivare. 


Hos oss står alltid konsulten i centrum, vår affär är uppbyggd kring vår förmåga att anställa och utveckla de bästa förmågorna inom våra områden.



Som privatägt bolag tittar vi inte på börskursen eller förbereder inför nästa kvartalsrapport, vi fokuserar istället på stabil och långsiktig utveckling, vilket bidrar med det samma för våra konsulter.



Utöver detta erbjuder vi:


* Förmånsprogram via vår partner Benify
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Bonus vid tips om rekrytering eller uppdrag
* Kollektivavtal
* Aktivitet er
* Konferenser
* Med mera

Vi är en del av Danirkoncernen https://danir.se/


https://sigmaindustryeastnorth.se/sigma-industry-innovation/



### **MORE INFORMATION**



Rekrytering sker löpande så vänta inte med att söka. Skicka även gärna med eran linkedin länk i ansökan.

  


Mikael Hagström



0706012715



Mikael.Hagström@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Gillar du El ?
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Services
* #### **LOCATION**


Västerås, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Geotechnical Engineering, Structural Engineering, Road and Landscape Architecture and Design, Environmental Consulting, Rail Design and Engineering, Water and Wastewater Engineering, Road Design and Traffic Planning, Calculation & Simulation, Industrial Design & Ergonomics, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing engineering incl. Logistics, Electricity & Automation, Energy & Power Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Project Management & Management, Life Science, QA & Validation, PLM, Audio/Acoustics, Opto engineering, Project Management, Project Management, Software development embedded systems, RF And Microwave, Function development, System design, Business Intelligence, Business Systems, System development, Operation, support and infrastructure, Test & Quality, Business Analysis, Digital Communication, Requirement Management & Business Development, Other, Project Management, Software, Client Tools & Skills, Generic, Field of Experience, Role Experience, Product, Product Information, Software development, Digitalisation, Digitalisation, Automation, Administration, Finance, HR, Management, Sales and Marketing, Sustainability
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-06-09
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-09-01

Mikael Hagström, mikael.hagstrom@sigma.se, +46706012715

title: Service Engineer- Brake
description:
**Discover your potential. Pursue your passion.**
Link Engineering Company (LINK) is a premier designer and manufacturer of precision test equipment, we specialize in developing customized solutions for Automotive, Aviation, Off-Highway, Rail and Civil Engineering industries. We are headquartered in Plymouth, Michigan, and maintain testing laboratories, manufacturing, and support facilities around the globe.
Established in 1935, we have been a family-owned company for generations, we treat our customers and employees as if they are part of our family. We set our employees up for success, as they are given constant opportunities to learn and develop new skills. As many of our team members have been with LINK for a generation or more, the LINK team is equipped with a wealth of knowledge, providing decades of hands-on experience and out-of-the-box thinking to OEMs and suppliers everywhere.  

  

We are looking for a Service Engineer/Technicianresponsible for the activities related to Field Service ( Repair,Software Support, Calibration and Preventive Maintenance), Parts ( Sales and Repair) and Equipment Commissioning for our customers based in Europe.  

**ACTIVITY**
* Independent commissioning, maintenance and calibration of brake testers and other test bench systems
* Fault analyses and repairs of all LINK systems and devices
* Support in the further development of our products through experience reports to product and service management


**PROFIL**
* Technician/master craftsman, engineering degree specializing in electrical engineering/mechatronics/mechanical engineering;
* Experience in calibration (Decelerometer, Accelerometer, Vmax Data Logger, Humidity sensors)
* Preferred previous experience in commissioning, maintenance, and repair of equipment test machine
* Knowledge of mechanical, hydraulic, electrical and software components
* Knowledge of MS Office
* Strong customer-oriented attitude
* Good knowledge of English language


  

**Soft skills**
* Customer and service-oriented appearance and corresponding work attitude;
* High level of stress resistance;
* Strong willingness to cooperate and ability to work in an international team;
* Willingness to travel (70%), mainly Europe


**WE OFFER**
* Career prospects in an international and dynamic company with a well-known tradition of quality and competence
* Varied and technically complex work content with high added value.
* International customers operating in Europe
* Professional and economic growth combined with acquired skills
* Technical training
* Good working atmosphere
* Attractive salary with flexible working hours and high job security
* Permanent employment contract

title: System Engineer - Nodes
description:
**Are you passionate about designing innovative solutions for the ocean?**

### **Welcome to Manta**


Manta is a technology company that provides solutions for marine autonomy. With a global operational and sales organization, we support our customers worldwide with life-of-field services and cutting-edge seismic acquisition solutions.

### **What's the role?**


As a System Engineer specializing in nodes at Manta, you will be instrumental in the development of our autonomous underwater systems. Your focus will be on designing, building, and integrating ocean bottom nodes that operate in challenging marine environments. Your responsibilities will include:

* Collaborating on system architecture and design.
* Developing firmware and software for hardware integration.
* Testing and validating systems to ensure performance and reliability in real-world conditions.
* Working with cross-functional teams to enhance product functionality.

**Requirements**

### **Who are we looking for?**

* Strong background in systems engineering, with experience in underwater robotics or related fields.
* Master’s degree in engineering, computer science, or a relevant technical discipline.
* Minimum of 5 years' experience in systems design and software development.
* Familiarity with marine sensors, data acquisition systems, and real-time processing.

### **What We Offer**


You will have the opportunity to be part of Manta's innovative journey and work alongside talented professionals. We provide comprehensive health care benefits, flexible working hours, occupational pension, and more.

### **Ready to Make an Impact?**


We value personal fit as much as technical skills. If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Electrical Engineer - Nodes
description:
**Are you passionate about electrical engineering and innovative technology? Do you want to be part of pioneering projects that shape the future of marine autonomy?**

### **Welcome to Manta**


Manta is a technology company that provides solutions for marine autonomy. With a global operational and sales organization, we support our customers worldwide with life-of-field services and cutting-edge seismic acquisition solutions.

### **What’s the role?**


As an Electrical Engineer specializing in Nodes, you will play a critical role in the development of electrical systems and components for our subsea technologies. Your responsibilities may include:

* Design and development of electrical systems for underwater nodes.
* Integrating hardware and software components to optimize system performance.
* Collaboration with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless project execution.
* Conducting testing and troubleshooting of node systems in various environments.
* Implementing best practices in engineering design and project management.

**Requirements**

### **Who are we looking for?**

* A strong background in electrical engineering.
* A grasp of embedded systems and control engineering.
* Experience with both junior and senior engineers welcomed.
* Team player with excellent communication skills.

### **What We Offer**


You will have the opportunity to be part of Manta's innovative journey and work alongside talented professionals. We provide comprehensive health care benefits, flexible working hours, occupational pension, and more.

### **Ready to Make an Impact?**


We value personal fit as much as technical skills. If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear from you!
