title: Embedded System Engineer (FPGA)
description:
**Job Description:**  

In this role, you will develop and optimize software-defined radio (SDR) solutions using Xilinx Zynq UltraScale+ RFSoC platform. You’ll be responsible for system-level design, FPGA programming, and integration with mmWave RF front-end components. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the intersection of embedded systems, FPGA design, and advanced wireless technologies in a fast-paced, research-driven environment.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Design and implement mmWave OFDM-based software-defined radio (SDR).
* Configure and program Xilinx Zynq UltraScale+ RFSoC using MATLAB/Simulink and Vivado.
* Perform algorithm partitioning between the FPGA logic (PL) and the ARM Cortex cores (PS).
* Integrate the RFSoC board with mmWave RF front-end components for end-to-end system functionality.
* Develop and implement advanced wireless communication systems with DSP algorithms on RFSoC


**Qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree in Embedded Systems, Wireless Communication Engineering, or a related field, with relevant industry experience.
* Strong proficiency in MATLAB/Simulink, HDL Coder, and FPGA design using Vivado and Vitis.
* Hands-on experience with embedded Linux and interactive Python workflows, including Jupyter Notebooks.
* Experience with the PYNQ open-source framework for programming and interacting with Xilinx Zynq RFSoC.
* Solid understanding of AXI interfaces, including AXI-Lite, AXI-Stream, and AXI DMA for PS–PL communication.
* Familiar with digital signal processing in wireless communication systems

title: Piping Spooling Engineer
description:
Gemkom Engineering and Machinery Filial is a newly established branch of the Turkish company Gemkom. It is a leading engineering and manufacturing company that operates in a number of areas and in various ways within the steel industry.
  
We are participating in a project where Stegra AB establishes a steel mill in Norra Svartbyn in Boden where steel will be produced through an almost fossil-free process using hydrogen gas. Our mission is, among other things, to install machines used in steel production and includes work in mechanics, electronics and plumbing.
  
We now want to employ Piping Spooling Engineer. The work tasks may include but are not limited to:
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

We are hiring a skilled Piping Spooling Engineer with experience in weld mapping and digital welding traceability systems such as Weld Log & Spool Log. This role is essential in ensuring the smooth coordination between piping design, spooling, and welding documentation for fabrication and construction projects.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Prepare and review piping spool drawings and isometric extraction from 3D models.
  
Assign weld numbers, create weld maps, and manage spool release packages.
  
Integrate spooling data into Weld Log & Spool Log or equivalent weld management software.
  
Ensure accurate traceability of welds, materials, and welders in line with QA/QC requirements.
  
Work closely with welding engineers, QC inspectors, and fabrication teams.
  
Maintain alignment of spool drawings with construction schedules and welding priorities.
  
Support the generation of weld logs and Spool log reports.
  
Assist in troubleshooting spooling or weld data inconsistencies.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, Piping Engineering, or related discipline.
  
8+ years of experience in piping fabrication & installation and spooling.
  
Proficient with spooling tools (e.g., Spoolgen, AutoCAD Plant 3D, Navisworks).
  
Experience using WeldLog or similar digital weld tracking tools.
  
Strong understanding of piping and welding codes (ASME B31.3/B31.1, ISO, API, EN 13480).
  
Detail-oriented with strong documentation and organizational skills.
  
  

**Preferred:**  

Experience in EPC & Contractor, oil & gas, or modular fabrication projects.
  
Familiarity with NDT processes and welding procedure documentation.
  
Knowledge of databases and reporting tools for weld traceability.

title: Development Engineer to Heliospectra
description:
Are you interested in shaping the future of green technology? Do you have a background in mechanical and/or mechatronic engineering and enjoy a hands-on role with diverse responsibilities? As a Development Engineer at Heliospectra, you'll step into a dynamic position where no two days are the same.
  
  

**JOB DESCRIPTION:**  

In a new, modern office located in central Gothenburg, you will join a team of seven people with short decision paths and openness to suggestions and new ideas. Heliospectra offers you the chance to work with an interesting product in a dynamic market where we strive to be at the forefront of technological advancements.
  
  

As a Development Engineer, you will hold a versatile position characterized by varying responsibilities and a dynamic workday. Your main focus will be on mechanical work, and you will also take a hands-on approach. You will have customer contact and act as technical support when questions arise, and when needed, travel to visit customers on-site. The role will be flexible and will also offer opportunities to work with software development and testing.
  
  

**Examples of responsibilities include:**  

Drafting and organizing documentation for technical components.
  
Creating a drawing library (e.g., for hangers and brackets).
  
Preparing technical documentation for manufacturing.
  
Provide customer support related to products and software.
  
Potential on-site customer support during system commissioning.
  
Conduct visits to customers and, when needed, to the production site.
  
  

**IDEAL CANDIDATE:**  

Bachelor’s degree from a university in mechanics and/or mechatronics.
  
Knowledge of CAD, preferably SolidWorks.
  
Fluent in English and Swedish for communication both internally and externally.
  
  

**Extra merit for experience in:**  

Software development (backend, embedded and/or frontend).
  
Wireless systems (Wifi, LoraWAN)
  
Network configuration
  
Thread wire bending
  
Plastic injection moulding
  
Hobby projects in software, mechanics and/or mechatronics.
  
Work-life experience from a similiar role.
  
  

To fit in well at Heliospectra and as a Development Engineer, we believe you are curious, engaged, and ready to take on new challenges to contribute to our development. You possess a driven and curious mindset with a "find a way" mentality. While working in a team, you are a good team player with a positive and outgoing mindset, always aiming to assist the team in solving tasks. You are also a good communicator.
  
  

**ABOUT THE CLIENT COMPANY:**  

Heliospectra is a market leader in intelligent LED grow lights for commercial growers and plant scientists. Our vision – to empower growers to consistently and sustainably produce crops of the highest quality, was established to increase the efficiencies of controlled environment food production using intelligent LED technology and automation software. This includes reducing energy costs, reducing production waste, and producing higher quality crops that look better, taste better, and last longer. Read more about Heliospectra here.
  
  

**EMPLOYMENT:**  

This is a temporary consulting assignment meaning you will initially be employed by Friday.
  
  

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**  

**Employment type:** Temporary assignment with good chances of extension.
  
**Start date:** December 2025 with the possibility to start hourly during the autumn.
  
**Location:** Johan Willins gata 8, Gothenburg.
  
**Point of contact:** Sophie Tisell.
  
**Salary:** Fixed monthly.
  
  

Apply by clicking the link below. Remember to be quick with your application as apply continuous selection of candidates and the position may be filled before the application deadline is due.
  
  

**ABOUT FRIDAY:**  

By being a partner to our clients and candidates, we strive to find the best match for both parties. We achieve this by really getting to know our clients and candidate’s needs! Of course, we will ensure that requirements and skillsets match. But above all, we focus on the importance to find harmony between values ​​and corporate culture which both candidate and client considers optimal.
  
  

Our passion is to help people to the right position, workplace and context within the IT and Technology field. That's also the reason to why we founded Friday, with the aim to help you find the job that gives you that Friday feeling – every day!
  
  

We mainly focus on young engineers who either are at the beginning of their career or soon graduating from university within the IT/Tech field.
  
  

Our belief is that people reach their fullest potential when looking forward to going to work each morning. "Friday - everyday", how about that?

title: Software Responsible
description:
Assignment Description – Software Responsible for Electrified Powertrain Systems
  
An exciting opportunity is available for a skilled and collaborative engineer with experience in embedded software responsibility within the automotive sector. The role is part of a high-performing team focused on the development of next-generation powertrain systems – ranging from hybrid engine control to fully electric drive units, including inverters and transmission systems.
  
The position involves leading software-related activities within embedded control units (ECUs or inverters) for one or more ongoing projects, with a strong emphasis on quality, innovation, and technical ownership.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Coordinate and lead the development of Base Software components within embedded control systems.
  
Work closely with system architects, hardware engineers, and application software developers in a collaborative setup.
  
Serve as the main point of contact for assigned suppliers, ensuring alignment on technology, budget, and delivery timelines.
  
Interpret technical requirements and convert them into viable, sustainable software solutions.
  
Contribute to a cross-functional environment where continuous improvement and technical excellence are central.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related technical field.
  
Proven experience in embedded software development for automotive control units such as ECM, TCM, or inverters.
  
Good knowledge of Base Software concepts, Autosar architecture, application integration, and communication protocols (e.g., CAN, LIN).
  
Strong experience with requirements management and technical coordination.
  
Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written. Knowledge of Swedish is considered a plus.
  
  

**Additional Information:**  

The assignment is conducted primarily via remote desktop environments; consultants are expected to use their own hardware (e.g., computer and phone when needed).
  
Ongoing selection – applications are reviewed continuously and the role may be filled before the application deadline.
  
Fast-track payment solutions are available after approved time reporting.
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Radio Network Systems Engineer Physical Layer Algorithms
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

At 5G/6G Baseband System Management our main task is to specify the wanted behavior of advanced radio network functions for the 5G NR RAN. We also engage in 3GPP standardization, develop and use simulators to optimize signal processing algorithms, develop baseband architectures, collect and analyze data from customer networks and perform troubleshooting.


We are looking for a Radio Network Systems Engineer that will join our excellent team and work with the signal processing, radio communication, development of 5G-software simulations, supporting the deployment of our new 5G products, and much, much more!

 **What you will do:**

  

* Perform systems studies in the area of Radio Physical Layer for radio functions like Beam Forming, Massive MIMO, 6G etc.
* Specify new 5G/6G system features and functions, including requirements, test cases, algorithms, use cases, parameter settings and address any interactions with legacy features and functionality
* Develop software simulations for the performance analysis of 5G features and algorithms, primarily link-level
* Contribute to advances of 5G/6G Standards. Update our Statement of Compliance to relevant standards
* Contribute to Innovation and Ericsson IPR. File Invention disclosures and Patents
* Support the deployment of new 5G/6G products and features into customer networks. Work with Customer troubleshooting and analysis. Understand customer configurations and issues.
* Work collaboratively on new features, simulations and improvements with cross-functional development teams situated locally as well as worldwide

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Strong background in communications theory and digital signal processing and mathematics
* Strong knowledge of LTE & NR 3GPP specifications, especially in the areas of the Physical Layer
* Experience in SW development for Link simulations. Languages include Python, C and C++
* Experience in the software development and analysis of simulations (knowledge of simulation environments and tools like MATLAB would be an asset)
* Analytical mindset and result orientation to deliver even when under pressure
* Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines and manage many different projects at once
* Excellent English skills, both verbal and written, providing effective communication building positive relationships internally as well as externally
* High level of motivation, as well as being a self-starter or a team player as needed
* M. Sc. or Ph.D. degree in a relevant area, preferably with demonstrated experience and knowledge in the above-mentioned required skills areas
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Embedded Engineer specializing in Qt development
description:
**Who we are:**  

Serstech develops handheld Raman spectrometers, which are used by law enforcement and first responders to identify narcotics and other hazardous chemicals. The instruments are slightly larger than a mobile phone and contains highly sophisticated optics, electronics and software. Serstech is the only manufacturer of handheld Raman instruments in the European Union and customers include United Nations and World Customs Organization. Production of Serstech’s products is done in Sweden by a third-party manufacturer.


The company and the team are both characterized by large flexibility, high skill-levels and clear customer focus. Our company values are excellence, joy, trust and openness. These values are important success factors and are nurtured, lived and encouraged daily.

**About the role:**  

Serstech’s instruments are running Linux on an ARM-based system. Large parts of the applications are written in Python and C++ and the GUI is using Qt. Low level C code is running on some of the peripherals included in the products. The big cost drivers of the instruments are mainly within the optical parts, which means that there are less constraints for the software parts than for many other systems – there is plenty of memory, storage and other resources to use.


Our instruments and solutions are characterized by ease of use and user centered design. We are now looking for an Embedded Developer with profound interest in Qt development.

**The successful candidate must have**

* at least five years of experience in embedded product development
* a master’s degree or corresponding knowledge level
* deep knowledge in development of Qt based UIs
* a deep understanding of, and a profound interest in technology
* a hands-on, collaborative, unpretentious and open mindset
* fluency in English, both spoken and written

**The successful candidate should have**

* experience from Python development and C++
* basic understanding of Git and Yocto
* basic understanding of the Swedish language

**Our culture**


We believe that openness and trust in combination with excellence are the keys to an innovative and joyful environment. Our competitors are huge, international corporations and we are convinced that we can continue to gain market share by being agile and customer focused. Everyone at the company are encouraged to contribute with ideas within any field or area, and we are strong believers in the fact that there are no stupid ideas or stupid questions. Together, we make the world safer and help reduce the threats from narcotics, bombs and chemical warfare agents.

**How to apply:**  

If you are ready to take the next step in your career and join a company that values growth, innovation, and dedication, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for this role here. If you have questions regarding the role, please email or call Jenny Månsson at Adeptus jenny@adeptus.se or call 0703-318506.


Join Serstech and help us shape the future of security!

**About Serstech**

*Serstech develops, manufactures, and markets handheld, optical instruments that are used by law enforcement, border control and military special forces to identify chemical threats. The threats include narcotics, explosives and chemical warfare agents and Serstech therefore contributes to making the world safer for everyone. Serstech’s products are sold through a global partner network and customers include United Nations, World Customs Organization and the narcotics police of a long list of countries.*

*Serstech is based in Lund and all production is done in Sweden. The company is on a strong growth journey and reported a 268% growth in 2023, driven by a strong market demand and highly competitive products.*

*Serstech is listed at Nasdaq First North Growth Market and has more than 3000 shareholders.*

title: Software Engineer - Digital Solutions
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med systemutveckling i flera spännande branscher, som Life Science, försvar och fordonsindustri. Du blir en del av ett dynamiskt team som använder moderna verktyg och tekniker för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Din roll omfattar hela utvecklingscykeln – från idé till implementation – där du får möjlighet att bidra med din kreativitet och problemlösningsförmåga.
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och brinner för att skapa användarvänliga och effektiva system. Du trivs i agila team och har en stark vilja att samarbeta med kollegor för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar. Din tekniska kompetens kombineras med en nyfikenhet att ständigt lära dig mer och växa i din roll.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software & Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Driva och delta i utvecklingsprojekt som skapar framtidens produkter.
* Förbättra och utveckla mjukvarulösningar med kreativa och innovativa metoder.
* Samarbeta med experter från olika discipliner för att lösa komplexa problem.
* Kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett sätt som engagerar både experter och lekmän.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i programmeringsspråk C# eller Java.
* Utvecklingsmiljö: Exempelvis Eclipse, Visual Studio eller IntelliJ.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i mjukvaruutvecklingsteam.
* Erfarenhet av branscher som life science, medtech, försvar eller fordonsindustri.
* Minst kandidatexamen inom ett relevant område.
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


**Önskvärt**
* Molntjänster: Exempelvis AWS eller Azure
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen


**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
   

  

 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
   

  

 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
   

  

 Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
   

  

**Praktisk information**
 Detta är en tillsvidareanställning med en provanställning på sex månader, placerad på vårt kontor i Solna, Rättarvägen 3. Resor i tjänsten kan förekomma till våra kunder. Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2025-06-30. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Margit Pettersson, Talent Acquisition Specialist. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Backendutvecklare (.NET Core/C#)
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Mitt i en spännande förändringsresa har vi startat ett nytt utvecklingsteam som bland annat driver moderniseringen av vår internetbank. Med målet att utveckla lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunders digitala upplevelse söker vi nu en backendutvecklare i .NET Core, C# som vill vara med tidigt på resan - här kommer dina idéer och din kod göra skillnad på riktigt!
 



 Hos oss blir du blir en del av ett härligt och ödmjukt team som tror på gemenskap och att lyckas tillsammans!
 



  





**Beskrivning** 




  





 Som backendutvecklare hos oss kommer du jobba med .Net Core och C# för att utveckla och förbättra våra mikrotjänster och integrationer. Du blir en del av ett agilt produktteam och kommer ha ett nära samarbete med produktägare, kravanalytiker, utvecklare och testare. Med en helt ny och modern arkitektur bygger vi tillsammans användarvänliga, kundfokuserade och digitala lösningar som hjälper människor att ta kloka beslut om sina bostäder, jord- och skogsföretag och sin ekonomi.
 



  





 Vi har en stark kultur präglad av öppenhet, samarbete och kundfokus och vi söker någon som vill bidra med sin kompetens för att tillsammans skapa en bättre framtid för våra kunder.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




  




* Utveckla och förbättra backendtjänster i .Net Core och C#.
* Designa mikrotjänster och implementera API:er för att säkerställa bra integrationer mellan olika system och appar.
* Samarbeta nära frontendutvecklare och andra team för att skapa sömlösa lösningar för våra kunder.
* Skriva automatiserade tester för att optimera koden och säkerställa att våra lösningar både är snabba och stabila och uppfyller alla krav.
* Samarbeta i teamet för att identifiera och lösa problem på ett kreativt och effektivt sätt.



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




  





 För att lyckas i rollen krävs det att du har:
 



  




* Mer än 5 års erfarenhet av att utveckla mikrotjänster i .Net Core och C#.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och konsumera RESTful API:er.
* Jobbat i agila, tvärfunktionella team tillsammans med produktägare, frontendutvecklare, kravansvariga och testare.
* God förståelse för databasdesign och erfaren av Microsoft SQL Server eller liknande.
* Kunskap om testdriven utveckling (TDD).
* Akademisk examen inom teknik eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift.



  





 Ett stort plus om du dessutom har:
 



  




* Erfarenhet och kunskap om mikrotjänstarkitektur.
* Är nyfiken på att jobba med hela utvecklingskedjan, däribland frontend (React).
* Erfarenhet av lösningsmönster med meddelandeköer och servicebussar.
* Erfarenhet av Git, Azure, Azure DevOps och CI/CD-principer.



  





 Som person har du en passion för mjukvaruutveckling, brinner för att lösa problem och har ett genuint teknologiintresse. Du gillar att samarbeta, är nyfiken och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss i vårt växande team. Du är också:
 



  




* Empatisk
* Inkluderande
* Prestigelös
* Leveransfokuserad
* Kommunikativ



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




  




* En varm och inkluderande arbetsmiljö där vi alla är med och påverkar Landshypotek Banks digitala framtid.
* Möjlighet att vara med tidigt i ett nytt och växande utvecklingsteam där din åsikt och kompetens verkligen gör skillnad.
* Ett hybrid arbetssätt och en bra balans mellan arbete och fritid.
* En bank som verkligen bryr sig om sina kunder och där du får möjlighet att jobba med produkter som gör skillnad i människors liv.
* Stöd för kontinuerligt lärande och personlig utveckling.



  





**Villkor** 




  





 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 100 % placerad på vårt fina kontor mitt i stan, en plats för samarbete och kulturbyggande där vi träffas regelbundet varje vecka. Samtidigt har du självklart möjlighet att jobba på distans när det behövs. Vi värdesätter mångfald och tror att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter stärker både vårt team och vår arbetsplatskultur.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder fina förmåner såsom generöst friskvårdbidrag, mängder av trevliga personalaktiviteter mm. Vi gör urval löpande och hoppas kunna ge återkoppling inom två veckor efter ansökan.
 



 Är du den vi söker? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och tillsammans bygga en framtid där våra kunder alltid är i fokus.

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (React/.NET) – Lead Frontend in Our Platform Team
description:
**Senior Fullstack Engineer (React/.NET) – Lead Frontend in Our Platform Team** 




**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Hybrid)
 



**Type:** 
 Full-time
 



**Start:** 
 As soon as possible
 



  





**About Myrspoven** 




 At Myrspoven, we’re transforming how buildings consume energy. Our AI-driven platform helps commercial and public property owners reduce CO₂ emissions and energy costs, while maintaining comfort for the people inside.
 



 We’ve been building and applying AI in production since 2018, long before the current hype, with a focus on real-world results, not buzzwords. You’ll be part of a tech organization that includes some of the best AI engineers in the industry, working alongside experienced developers in the Platform team to deliver real climate impact.
 



 We’re a growing scale-up at the intersection of proptech, AI, and sustainability, with a product already live across thousands of buildings.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We’re looking for a seasoned fullstack engineer to take the lead on frontend development within our Platform team. This team owns both the backend platform and all internal and customer-facing tools.
 



 You’ll be responsible for driving the development of our frontend into the critical tool allowing users to efficiently work with our product. The frontend spans everything from tools for configuring our AI’s objectives, to rich visualizations of time-series data, AI predictions and actionable insights for our customers. You will be in a position to have a significant impact on how our product is perceived so you will be expected to work closely with product owners, engineers, and domain experts to build features that are both powerful and easy to use. 
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Take ownership of our React-based frontends and lead their evolution
* Build intuitive, performant, and maintainable interfaces for internal and external users
* Implement admin and configuration UIs that allow users to set up and customize our product
* Create effective data visualizations and graphs to make complex energy data actionable
* Define and consume APIs, and occasionally create or update .NET endpoints
* Contribute to architecture and design decisions across the stack
* Work closely with product and energy experts to ensure we’re solving the right problems
* Bring structure and clarity to how we do frontend development



  





**What We’re Looking For**
